commit_message:
haproxy: pass client cert during TLS healthcheck

Some Openstack services are configured to enforce client
certificate verification when connecting to them over TLS.

For connection to work, we need to generate an HAproxy
configurations that explicitely passes the client cert
when doing healthchecks with TLS-e.

Closes-Bug: #2024201

Change-Id: If34cbd1f36b7db6b4287f287dacdc3fdc08343e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/90/886290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $member_client_cert_path = $internal_cert_path $member_client_cert_path = $public_certificate $member_client_cert_path = '' if ('ssl' in $member_options) and ($member_client_cert_path != '') { $member_options_ext = union($member_options, ["crt ${member_client_cert_path}"]) } else { $member_options_ext = $member_options } options => union($member_options_ext, ["cookie ${server}"]), options => $member_options_ext,

commit_message:
Fix container name already exists handling

The logic for preventing to start a container with the same name
is not working due to a bad match in the grep command. However the whole
logic of checking if the container exists can be replaced by the --replace
argument starting with podman 2.0. For the docker case, I kept the code and fixed the
grep command by replacing `$` with the literal delimeter `:`. A LIST element
is in the format as specified in docker ps --format. E.i.
d3ffda4c1e0e:neutron-haproxy-ovnmeta-3f52da69-6bf0-41d9-8c70-d3113426a602:Up

Closes-Bug: #2035284
Change-Id: I0199eb6a369eb83cdfd4fba5decd388e802ece93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/31/894931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Manually remove orphaned containers and ensure that the script does not try to run a container with the name that # already exists. In the podman case, this is handled by the '--replace' argument. There does not seem to be equivalent in docker. REPLACE_ARG=''printf "%s\n" "${LIST}" | grep -q "${NAME}" && NAME="${NAME}-$(date +%Y-%m-%d-%H%M%S-%N)" <%- } elsif $container_cli == 'podman' { -%> CLI="nsenter --net=/run/netns/${NETNS} --preserve-credentials -m -t 1 podman" LOGGING="--log-driver k8s-file --log-opt path=/var/log/containers/stdouts/${NAME}.log" CMD='$HAPROXY' REPLACE_ARG='--replace' <%- } else { -%> CLI='echo noop' CMD='echo noop' <%- } -%> $CLI run ${REPLACE_ARG} \ --detach ${LOGGING} \
deleted_lines: <%- } elsif $container_cli == 'podman' { -%> CLI="nsenter --net=/run/netns/${NETNS} --preserve-credentials -m -t 1 podman" LOGGING="--log-driver k8s-file --log-opt path=/var/log/containers/stdouts/${NAME}.log" CMD='$HAPROXY' <%- } else { -%> CLI='echo noop' CMD='echo noop' <%- } -%># FIXME(cjeanner): https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1703printf "%s\n" "${LIST}" | grep -q "${NAME}$" && NAME="${NAME}-$(date +%Y-%m-%d-%H%M%S-%N)"$CLI run --detach ${LOGGING} \

commit_message:
Even with ipv6, mysql should still listen on an IP

Use ${gmcast_listen_addr} instead of [::].  IPv6 behavior should not
be different than the IPv4 behavior here.

Change-Id: I3fa45282ccd1c7d5fb1c4c6c19e823debe974044

commit_message:
Detect ip version in masquerade_network for firewall rules

If an operator is switching from ipv4 to ipv6 and was using
masquerading on the undercloud for any reasons (isolation, SPOF, etc)
this setting is non-functionnal and requires this or something
equivalent.   Perhaps a clear message in the doc about it not being
supported could also be considered.

Change-Id: I38210cd546e65ea858e1a556c52a307a0edd9e73

commit_message:
Add cinder::scheduler::filter to scheduler.pp

Previously, cinder::scheduler::filter is not included in scheduler.pp.
The user needs to define scheduler_default_filter by cinder_config
though cinder::scheduler::filter provides the interface.
This change includes cinder::scheduler::filter for parameters.

Change-Id: I449ce4b07c23bc524588a85bed33eea63bbd82bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/67/900967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include cinder::scheduler::filter

commit_message:
validate cephfs name for deployed ceph

During overcloud deploy, if the cephfs filestystem
name is explicitly configured via new parameter introduced
in [1], we fail the deployement with exception.

The parameter is intended only for external ceph cluster.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/904034

Change-Id: I4a909402cc9a0af5bd8c934fd4679678c67338f7

commit_message:
Fix large bm deploy file, ansible arugment to long

When using a very large baremetal deployment definition yaml
file ansible-playbook fails with "too large argument".

Instead of parsing the yaml file and passing the potentially large
list to ansible use ansible's lookup plugin instead.

Resolves rhbz#2249593

Change-Id: I02ffb9964b5758de396c8c9c686c1e21a0ba9cd0

commit_message:
Make sure tripleo-admin is created in an update scenario

For some reasons, in this environment with edge sites, the
authorized_keys changed and tripleo-admin no longer worked and
the "upgrade prepare" or "deploy" cannot be ran at this point
in time of the update.   This patches makes sure tripleo-admin
is always properly configured.

Change-Id: I53894579a4eeedbea5aa861b677def9de601bfbb

commit_message:
Pass timeout from overcloud deploy command for heat deploy

The timeout specified in [1] for heat_deploy method was
never passed to deploy_without_plan method [2].
This will hugely impact our customers at scale as the
stack_action_timeout is set to 3600 seconds by default and
heat stack would fail.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/stable/wallaby/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py#L133
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/stable/wallaby/tripleoclient/workflows/deployment.py#L46
Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2239130

Co-Authored-By: rpulapak@redhat.com
Change-Id: I79816adee566770011eb6de407a9bfc03d8529ac

commit_message:
Try yaml then try json loading if a ConstructorError occurs

If operators are using {{ }} in their nic templates, the yaml loading
fails with an unhashable key due to {{ }} not being valid .yaml format
but apparently is a valid json key.   This regression was induced with
bd45a745da1ef95718a5a6893f510ef02937f1b5 commit.

Change-Id: I60d3d9ee942a9a116ce8d79d956f106e2b8117e7

commit_message:
Allows system upgrade if ssh key works on Upgraded System

OS upgrade increase the size of the valid ssh keys. The old
ssh keys might not work depends on the size of them. This
patch checks the size of the ssh key and only allows the
upgrade when the size of the key is bigger or equals to 2048

Change-Id: I2c1bd0fd32cd1f11d6a6bb1977b2bb836e8eb2fe

commit_message:
Increase retry time to ephemeral Heat message queue

Wait for a total of 60s, with retries every 1s. The previous settings
were too aggressive and did not wait long enough in some environments.
Removes the stop_after_attempt call as well since it can conflict with
what is set for stop_after_delay, and we want to wait the full 60s.

Change-Id: I258ba5ca0526cb34fe267bd9b89af2763f7822fe
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/80/885580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stop=stop_after_delay(60), wait=wait_fixed(1))

commit_message:
Validate keystone passwords if keystonepasswordregex is present

Validate keystone passwords if keystonepasswordregex is present as
many operator specify a password regex that doesn't match default
password generation and deployment breaks later on.

Change-Id: I956bbdf9296d324b36737aab1c8b055311e1f928
Solves: rhbz#2210350

Validate keystone passwords if keystonepasswordregex is present as
many operator specify a password regex that doesn't match default
password generation and deployment breaks later on.

Solves: rhbz#2210350

commit_message:
Add proxy validation to deploy and upgrade preflight

Add proxy validation to deploy and upgrade preflight .   Especially the
no_proxy variable as it's causing lots of issues with users doing a FFU
from queens to train.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/848871
Change-Id: I3a496d8517f10df660d9b4125f7c40964e90eac7

commit_message:
Implement --db-only backups for overcloud

This new change allows an operator to take a database backup from
the first host in the Controller group by using `openstack overcloud
backup --db-only`

Change-Id: I9ccf3154e9052df97383d460f0c0f87a5370e7ef
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/854620

added_lines: '--db-only', default=False, action='store_true', help=_("Perform a DB backup of the first host in 'Controller' " "group. The DB backup file will be stored in /home/stack " "with the name " "openstack-backup-mysql-overcloud-<timestamp>.sql.") ) parser.add_argument( if parsed_args.db_only is True: self._run_ansible_playbook( playbook='cli-overcloud-db-backup.yaml', inventory=parsed_args.inventory, tags=None, skip_tags=None, extra_vars=extra_vars )

commit_message:
wallaby: Ignore SameFileError in utils.copy_to_wd()

If the file referenced is already the working copy
ignore the SameFileError raised by shutil.

Closes-Bug: 2008456
Change-Id: I5af0d481e1d0df74c0bd7300c6aa02059cc5aea7
(cherry picked from commit 7cf0cbd90acd0097cd9a29c22c318741c6447056)

added_lines: try: shutil.copy(src, dest) except shutil.SameFileError: pass

commit_message:
Allow package install to be skipped for image build

This allows the image build command to be called where the tripleo
dependencies are installed via pip (even in a venv). This makes
development of image builder elements more practical.

Change-Id: I93ca15338c932d52c7eb007b36fcc29be19f8f1b
(cherry picked from commit 295cffefc773a6dde7cdc38e4c470eb23a32e3ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/63/874363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "--no-package-install", dest="package_install", action="store_false", default=True, help=_("Skip installing required packages."), ) parser.add_argument( if parsed_args.package_install: self._ensure_packages_installed()

commit_message:
Track upgrade state and step for Overcloud upgrade

Track in the plan the state and step of the Overcloud
upgrade by adding three fields:
upgrade_state: MajorUpgradePrepare
upgrade_step: Inprogress / Success / Failed
upgrade_release: master

Change-Id: I5a5009fcefaac8df7f80f6bd760b7213ea1e503c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/73/702873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set upgrade status: oooutils.set_upgrade_status(clients, "MajorUpgradePrepare", "InProgress") try: deployment.get_hosts_and_enable_ssh_admin( self.log, clients, stack, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_network, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_user, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_key, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_enable_timeout, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_port_timeout) except exceptions.DeploymentError: oooutils.set_upgrade_status(clients, "MajorUpgradePrepare", "Failed") raise oooutils.set_upgrade_status(clients, "MajorUpgradePrepare", "Success")
deleted_lines: deployment.get_hosts_and_enable_ssh_admin( self.log, clients, stack, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_network, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_user, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_key, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_enable_timeout, parsed_args.overcloud_ssh_port_timeout)

commit_message:
Add handling for cases where there is no VIP

If there is no VIP configured in the users templates, then we currently
end up returning a traceback rather than a more user friendly error
message. This change adds the user friendly message to handle that
situation.

Change-Id: I27d77301c5ea45b2e9ed858402db13226d0bbf95

commit_message:
Use mergable inventory format for openstack tripleo deploy

The overcloud deploy switched to mergable inventory format in
I540267b22756ba64763ee2cb8f78720b7e22e7ac. Use as similar approach for the
openstack tripleo deploy command.

commit_message:
WIP - Refactoring preflight checks and validations

The goal of this review is to refactor the preflight checks
for undercloud, tripleo and overcloud deploy in order to
centralized all those checks into a common place in tripleo-validations.
The major gain of this approach is:
* allow operators to run preflight checks on demmand, outside of the
  tripleo CLI deploy command with the Validation Framework binary.
* the checks will be logged on the fs and the history could be retrieved
* the checks sometimes overlap existing validations, so converging those will
  avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I165eb65c54a2767b916d947251771b5548cb7071

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import logging import subprocess import sys from osc_lib.i18n import _ from oslo_config import cfg from tripleoclient import constants from tripleoclient import utils class FailedValidation(Exception): pass CONF = cfg.CONF # We need 8 GB, leave a little room for variation in what 8 GB means on # different platforms. REQUIRED_MB = 7 LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".UndercloudSetup") def _run_live_command(args, env=None, name=None, cwd=None, wait=True): """Run the command defined by args, env and cwd Either returns the process handler or runs the process asynchronously so the output can be logged while the process is still running. """ if name is None: name = args[0] process = subprocess.Popen(args, env=env, cwd=cwd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, universal_newlines=True) if not wait: return process while True: line = process.stdout.readline() if line: LOG.info(line.rstrip()) if line == '' and process.poll() is not None: break if process.returncode != 0: message = '%s failed. See log for details.' % name LOG.error(message) raise RuntimeError(message) def _run_validations(playbooks=[], inventory='undercloud', extra_args=None): """Run tripleo-validations playbook """ args = ['validation', 'run', '-i', inventory, '--validation', ','.join(playbooks), '--extra-vars', extra_args] _run_live_command(args) def _checking_status(item): LOG.info(_('Checking %s...') % item) def undercloud_checks(verbose_level, upgrade=False, net_config_yaml=None): # Fetch configuration and use its log file param to add logging to a file utils.load_config(CONF, constants.UNDERCLOUD_CONF_PATH) utils.configure_logging(LOG, verbose_level, CONF['undercloud_log_file']) # data = {opt.name: CONF[opt.name] for opt in _opts} try: _checking_status('Hostname') _run_validations(['check-uc-hostname']) _checking_status('Memory') _run_validations(['check-ram'], extra_args='minimal_ram_gb='.format(REQUIRED_MB)) _checking_status('Disk space') if upgrade: _run_validations( constants.DEPLOY_ANSIBLE_ACTIONS['preflight-upgrade']) else: _run_validations( constants.DEPLOY_ANSIBLE_ACTIONS['preflight-deploy']) _checking_status('Sysctl') _run_validations(['undercloud_sysctl']) _checking_status('Password file') #TODO: handle config file pass _run_validations(['validate_passwords_file']) _checking_status('Deprecated now invalid options') _validate_deprecetad_now_invalid_parameters() # Heat templates validations if CONF.get('custom_env_files'): _checking_status('Custom env file') _validate_env_files_paths() # Networking validations _checking_status('Networking values') _validate_value_formats() _check_routed_networks_enabled_if_multiple_subnets_defined() _check_all_or_no_subnets_use_dns_nameservers() for subnet in CONF.subnets: s = CONF.get(subnet) _checking_status('Subnet "%s" is in CIDR' % subnet) _validate_in_cidr(s, subnet) _checking_status('DHCP range is in subnet "%s"' % subnet) _validate_dhcp_range(s, subnet) _checking_status('Inspection range for subnet "%s"' % subnet) _validate_inspection_range(s) _validate_dnsnameservers(s) _checking_status('IP addresses') _validate_ips() _checking_status('Network interfaces') _validate_interface_exists() _checking_status('Provisioning IP change') _validate_no_ip_change(net_config_yaml) _checking_status('Architecture') _validate_architecure_options() except KeyError as e: LOG.error(_('Key error in configuration: {error}\n' 'Value is missing in configuration.').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1) except FailedValidation as e: LOG.error(_('An error occurred during configuration ' 'validation, please check your host ' 'configuration and try again.\nError ' 'message: {error}').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1) except RuntimeError as e: LOG.error(_('An error occurred during configuration ' 'validation, please check your host ' 'configuration and try again. Error ' 'message: {error}').format(error=e)) sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
Add 'pci-devices' to Inspector collectors

When undercloud.conf option inspection_extras is enabled
add the 'pci-devices' collector.

pci-devices
  Collects the list of PCI devices. Provides one key:
    pci_devices - list of objects with keys vendor_id and product_id.

Change-Id: I5aa8716919a4ebc11a7ec73698083f0af109e3a1

commit_message:
auth_ed25519: generate DB passwords suitable for FIPS

For FIPS compliance, auth_ed25519 should only rely on OpenSSL and
generate passwords made of 32 bytes of random data.

At deploy time, default passwords are generated by a module from
tripleo-common, and the DB passwords are generated differently when
auth_ed25519 is enabled.

Look for auth_ed25519 option in user environment to configure the
generation of DB passwords appropriately for FIPS.

Tested by deploying a standalone environment and HA overcloud
Stack update on a HA overcloud keeps existing passwords as expected

Closes-Bug: #1960271
Depends-On: I00d3d2a43d08d3d317a25c7ecb54d197e36a8f93

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-07 07:27:39.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/3df29fac51d765e2ec03b9112f3fe70b60d394f3', 'message': "Check nested rsrc template for neutron with ephemeral heat

When using ephemeral Heat, the Neutron service is not
available to Heat.

This change extends the esisting method which check's for
neutron resources when epehmeral heat is used. Exception is
now also raised for neutron resource in nested template
resources. The check will search recursively in case there
are nested resource templates.

Change-Id: I5fc40106ce1d908c7d2a314a4518f3d73fca1650
"}]
commit_message:
Check nested rsrc template for neutron with ephemeral heat

When using ephemeral Heat, the Neutron service is not
available to Heat.

This change extends the esisting method which check's for
neutron resources when epehmeral heat is used. Exception is
now also raised for neutron resource in nested template
resources. The check will search recursively in case there
are nested resource templates.

Change-Id: I5fc40106ce1d908c7d2a314a4518f3d73fca1650
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/72/828072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_neutron_resources_recursive(template_resource): with request.urlopen(template_resource) as response: rsrc_tpl = yaml.safe_load(response.read()) for k, v in rsrc_tpl.get('resources', {}).items(): type = v.get('type', str()) if type.startswith("OS::Neutron"): raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration( msg2.format(rsrc, rsrc_type, k, v['type'])) elif type.startswith("file://"): check_neutron_resources_recursive(type) msg1 = ("Resource {} maps to type {} and the Neutron " "service is not available when using ephemeral Heat. " "The generated environments from " "'openstack overcloud baremetal provision' and " "'openstack overcloud network provision' must be included " "with the deployment command.") msg2 = ("Resource {} maps to template resource {}, the resuource {} in " "the template resource maps resource of type {}. The Neutron " "service is not available when using ephemeral Heat. The " "generated environments from" "'openstack overcloud baremetal provision' and " "'openstack overcloud network provision' must be included with " "the deployment command.") for rsrc, rsrc_type in registry.items(): if not isinstance(rsrc_type, str): continue if rsrc_type.startswith("OS::Neutron"): raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(msg1.format(rsrc, rsrc_type)) elif rsrc_type.startswith("file://"): check_neutron_resources_recursive(rsrc_type)
deleted_lines: msg = ("Resource {} maps to type {} and the Neutron " "service is not available when using ephemeral Heat. " "The generated environments from " "'openstack overcloud baremetal provision' and " "'openstack overcloud network provision' must be included " "with the deployment command.") for rsrc, rsrc_type in registry.items(): if (type(rsrc_type) == str and rsrc_type.startswith("OS::Neutron")): raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(msg.format(rsrc, rsrc_type))

subject: Adding check for NeutronOVSFirewallDriver in OVS-DPDK deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-16 13:43:26.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/40b189a65847d4e8651ab06a956be469d4690484', 'message': 'Adding check for NeutronOVSFirewallDriver in OVS-DPDK deployments

For OVS-DPDK deployments, setting iptables as firewall driver is not
appropriate. Hence when dpdk service is enabled in compute node,
check for proper firewall settings in user environment files
heat-templates.

Change-Id: I712302f4888427ed954df83b5b4cef6f8d6ad5b4
'}]
commit_message:
Adding check for NeutronOVSFirewallDriver in OVS-DPDK deployments

For OVS-DPDK deployments, setting iptables as firewall driver is not
appropriate. Hence when dpdk service is enabled in compute node,
check for proper firewall settings in user environment files
heat-templates.

Change-Id: I712302f4888427ed954df83b5b4cef6f8d6ad5b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/43/829543/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_fw_option_enabled(env_file): """Checks environment file for firewall driver settings. :param env_file: The path of the environment file :type env_file: String :raises CommandError: If the action is not confirmed """ compute_dpdk = False firewall_valid = True if os.path.exists(env_file): with open(env_file, "r") as f: content = yaml.safe_load(f) for key in content: # Check if computedpdk is enabled if key.startswith('resource_registry'): dict = content['resource_registry'] for k in dict: if (k.startswith ('OS::TripleO::ComputeOvsDpdkSriov::')): compute_dpdk = True # Read FW driver settings if key.startswith("parameter_defaults"): dict = content['parameter_defaults'] for k in dict: if ((k.startswith('NeutronOVSFirewallDriver')) and (dict[k] not in ['openvswitch', 'noop'])): firewall_valid = False if (compute_dpdk) and not firewall_valid: # For ComputeOvsDpdkSriov, firewall driver recommended is # openvswitch message = "Firewall driver is not recommended,\ Do you still wish to continue deployment [y/N]" confirm = prompt_user_for_confirmation(message, logger=LOG) if not confirm: raise oscexc.CommandError("Action not confirmed, exiting.") def check_usr_firewallcfg_for_computesrv(environment_files): for env_file in environment_files: check_fw_option_enabled(env_file)

commit_message:
WIP: set nova::dhcp_domain on undercloud

Depends-On: Iabcf07bd5c43bcc563b139dfd94d927a987389aa
Change-Id: Ieb99a7efcf65dfc96e114d93507ef64b5ef3cb3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/38/796038/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: env_data['NovaDhcpDomain'] = CONF['overcloud_domain_name']

subject: Add multi-rhel support for OvnController
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-18 04:33:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/d71872bf920d054d692b1c1034e7898636ef3da8', 'message': "Add multi-rhel support for OvnController

This change adds support for multi-rhel
OvnController handling. For this, we
rely on the user providing the namespaces
key in the CIP dict. If namespaces is defined
we will loop over them and assign the Heat
params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
  - set:
      [...]
      namespaces: ['quay.io/tripleomastercentos9', 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos8']
      [...]

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerOvnControllerImages8: quay.io/tripleomastercentos8/openstack-ovn-controller:current-tripleo
  ContainerOvnControllerImages9: quay.io/tripleomastercentos9/openstack-ovn-controller:current-tripleo

This will be used by:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/848208

Change-Id: Ided6add8027d32e3d08bb6a88045642e8f7bc3d7

commit_message:
Add multi-rhel support for OvnController

This change adds support for multi-rhel OvnController handling.
For this, we rely on the user providing the namespaces key in
the CIP dict. If namespaces is defined we will loop over them
and assign the Heat params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
  - set:
      [...]
      multi_rhel:
      '9':
         namespace: 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos9'
         tag: 'my_tag'
      '8':
         namespace: 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos8'
         tag: 'rhel8_tag'
      [...]

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerOvnControllerImage: {
       8: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos8/openstack-ovn-controller:rhel8_tag",
       9: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos9/openstack-ovn-controller:my_tag"
  }

This will be used by:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/848208

Change-Id: Ided6add8027d32e3d08bb6a88045642e8f7bc3d7

commit_message:
Don't manipulate warnings

A library should not be doing this. If you want warnings, enable them at
the application level.

Change-Id: I4b83843594ca419773821b3b191b3055e5e3b8bb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #2033548

commit_message:
Allow an operator to use complex passwords in keystone

As it is, tripleo generated keystone passwords are only using ascii_60
but PCI-DSS and some other standards requires the use of special symbols
which is provided by ascii_72.

Change-Id: I46474baef50907c9a0c52e9814fa541a08872c63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/12/884512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use_complex_passwords = stack_env.get('parameter_defaults', {}) \ .get('UseComplexPasswords', False) if use_complex_passwords: password_charset = 'ascii_72' else: password_charset = 'ascii_62' passwords[name] = passlib.pwd.genword(length=_MIN_PASSWORD_SIZE, charset=password_charset)

commit_message:
Remove workaround for nettle on tcib base image

This removes an earlier workaround for related-bug as it is now
causing new bug [1]

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2181513
Related-Bug: 1984237

Change-Id: Id5b53802840026ecebb36a444f6d5c2ea07d6688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/24/878524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO: Temporary pinning nettle to 3.8-3.el9, so it can be reinstalled from centos-9 repos. # nettle-3.8-3 is already installed in ubi9 image, but it conflicts with newer versions on gnutls # installed from centos-9 repos. This workaround can be reverted once ubi9.2 is released, which # should contain a newer version of gnutls with fixes to run under FIPS mode. # See: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2154924 and # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1984237 - run: >- if [ '{{ tcib_release }}' == '9' ];then dnf -y install nettle-3.8-3.el9; fi

commit_message:
Remove workaround for nettle on tcib base image

This removes an earlier workaround for related-bug as it is now
causing new bug [1]

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2181513
Related-Bug: 1984237

(cherry picked from commit f48e4d0815eb7d207eabb114de7b234b5dc0f0ca)
Change-Id: Id5b53802840026ecebb36a444f6d5c2ea07d6688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/54/878654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO: Temporary pinning nettle to 3.8-3.el9, so it can be reinstalled from centos-9 repos. # nettle-3.8-3 is already installed in ubi9 image, but it conflicts with newer versions on gnutls # installed from centos-9 repos. This workaround can be reverted once ubi9.2 is released, which # should contain a newer version of gnutls with fixes to run under FIPS mode. # See: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2154924 and # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1984237 - run: >- if [ '{{ tcib_release }}' == '9' ];then dnf -y install nettle-3.8-3.el9; fi

commit_message:
Remove python-dev from bindep

It is no longer supported by jammy and lead us to the following errors with the announce-release job.

```
No package matching 'python-dev' is available
```

Change-Id: I63def768e3a2d43dd73d7ab5ced3a779b7469f65

commit_message:
Add multi-rhel support for Nova services

This change adds support for multi-rhel nova-compute and nova-libvirt handling.
For this, we rely on the user providing the namespaces key in the CIP dict.
If namespaces is defined we will loop over them and assign the Heat params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
  - set:
      [...]
      namespaces: ['quay.io/tripleomastercentos9', 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos8']
      [...]

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerNovaLibvirtConfigImage: {
       8: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos8/nova-libvirt:current-tripleo",
       9: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos9/nova-libvirt:current-tripleo"
  }

Change-Id: I17e99004daee64b8d78c3d0f3f1d09b17009b11e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/11/853211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% for ns in namespaces %} - imagename: "{{namespace}}/{{name_prefix}}nova-compute{{name_suffix}}:{{tag}}" image_source: tripleo params: - ContainerNovaComputeImage - ContainerNovaLibvirtConfigImage services: - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaCompute - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirt - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaMigrationTarget {% endfor %}

commit_message:
WIP: FFWD3: Add multi-rhel support for OvnController

This change adds support for multi-rhel OvnController handling.
For this, we rely on the user providing the namespaces key in
the CIP dict. If namespaces is defined we will loop over them
and assign the Heat params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
      os_dependant:
          '9':
              namespace: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos"
              name_prefix: "wallaby-openstack-"
              name_suffix: ''
              tag: '20220802.1'
          '8':
              namespace: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos"
              name_prefix: "wallaby-openstack-"
              name_suffix: ''
              tag: '20220622.1'

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerOvnControllerImage: {
       8: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos/openstack-ovn-controller:20220802.1",
       9: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos/openstack-ovn-controller:20220622.1"
  }

This will be used by:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/848208

Change-Id: Ided6add8027d32e3d08bb6a88045642e8f7bc3d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/37/852437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _deep_merge(dict1={}, dict2={}): """ Deep merge two dictionaries to maintain existing key values """ for k, _ in dict2.items(): if (k in dict1 and isinstance(dict1[k], dict) and isinstance(dict2[k], dict)): _deep_merge(dict1[k], dict2[k]) else: dict1[k] = dict2[k] return(dict1)

commit_message:
Add multi-rhel support for Storage services

This change adds support for multi-rhel Iscsid and Multipathd handling.
For this, we rely on the user providing the namespaces key in
the CIP dict. If namespaces is defined we will loop over them
and assign the Heat params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
  - set:
      [...]
      namespaces: ['quay.io/tripleomastercentos9', 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos8']
      [...]

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerIscsidImage: {
       8: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos8/openstack-iscsid:current-tripleo",
       9: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos9/openstack-iscsid:current-tripleo"
  }

Change-Id: Idcfee1db54cf4d49d4cf23a8d68dc65c1b79ce42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/07/853207/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% for ns in namespaces %} - imagename: "{{namespace}}/{{name_prefix}}multipathd{{name_suffix}}:{{tag}}" image_source: tripleo params: - ContainerMultipathdConfigImage - ContainerMultipathdImage services: - OS::TripleO::Services::Multipathd - imagename: "{{namespace}}/{{name_prefix}}iscsid{{name_suffix}}:{{tag}}" image_source: tripleo params: - ContainerIscsidConfigImage - ContainerIscsidImage services: - OS::TripleO::Services::Iscsid {% endfor %}

commit_message:
WIP Improve tripleo-mount-image unmount cleanup

Change-Id: I6d0cb5d532903200431e7a5cdd16ae05497ec096
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/60/848560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -d $MOUNT_DIR/dev ]; then mount -o bind /dev $MOUNT_DIR/dev/ EACTION="umount $MOUNT_DIR/dev/; $EACTION" if [ -w $MOUNT_DIR ]; then resolv=$MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf if [ -e $resolv ] || [ -L $resolv ]; then mv $resolv $resolv.tmi EACTION="mv $resolv.tmi $resolv; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT fi cp /etc/resolv.conf $resolv EACTION="rm $resolv; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT fi root_fstype="" devices=(${NBD_DEVICE}p*) if [[ "${#devices[@]}" == "1" ]]; then if [[ "${devices[0]}" == "${NBD_DEVICE}p*" ]]; then # if wildcard didn't expand to paths then there are no partition devices, assume one root device root_device=${NBD_DEVICE} devices=() else # if there is one partition device, assume it is the root device root_device=${devices[0]} devices=() fi for device in ${devices[@]}; do root_fstype=$fstype if [[ "$root_fstype" == "btrfs" ]]; then # Fedora has a btrfs filesystem with a subvolume called root. # For now assume there will be a 'root' subvolume, but in the # future the subvolume layout may need to be discovered for different # images mount -o subvol=root $root_device $MOUNT_DIR else # a simple root partition mount $root_device $MOUNT_DIR fi
deleted_lines: mount -o bind /dev $MOUNT_DIR/dev/ EACTION="umount $MOUNT_DIR/dev/; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT if [ -a $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf ]; then mv $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf.tmi EACTION="mv $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf.tmi $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf; $EACTION" cp /etc/resolv.conf $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf EACTION="rm $MOUNT_DIR/etc/resolv.conf; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT devices="${NBD_DEVICE}p*" if [[ "$devices" == *"*"* ]]; then # if wildcard didn't expand to paths then there are no partition devices, assume one root device root_device=${NBD_DEVICE} devices="" elif ! [[ "$devices" == *" "* ]]; then # if there is one partition device, assume it is the root device root_device=${devices} devices="" for device in ${devices}; do # a simple root partition mount $root_device $MOUNT_DIR

commit_message:
WIP improved cleanup on tripleo-mount-image failure

Change-Id: Ib10ea85adf74cf5ad04705d114137031be616318
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/59/848559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EACTION="" dmsetup remove $(basename $1) EACTION="echo Exited chroot, unmounting $MOUNT_DIR ; $EACTION" EACTION="unmount_image; $EACTION" trap "$EACTION" EXIT timeout 2 sh -c "while ! ls ${NBD_DEVICE}p* ; do sleep 1; done" || true devices="${NBD_DEVICE}p*" if [[ "$devices" == *"*"* ]]; then # if wildcard didn't expand to paths then there are no partition devices, assume one root device devices="" elif ! [[ "$devices" == *" "* ]]; then echo "The image is mounted to $MOUNT_DIR" set +e remove_device /dev/mapper/vg-lv_root if [ -n "$CHROOT" ]; then else # Clear any cleanup commands, the image should remain mounted trap "" EXIT echo "Unmount with: tripleo-unmount-image -m $MOUNT_DIR"
deleted_lines: dmsetup remove $1 EACTION="echo Exited chroot, unmounting $MOUNT_DIR ; unmount_image" timeout 5 sh -c "while ! ls ${NBD_DEVICE}p* ; do sleep 1; done" || true set +e devices=$(ls ${NBD_DEVICE}p*) set -e device_count=$(echo $devices | wc -w) if [ $device_count == "0" ]; then # if there are no partition devices, assume one root device elif [ $device_count == "1" ]; then remove_device vg-lv_root if [ -n $CHROOT ]; then

commit_message:
[CS9] Rework dnf modules

This change makes dnf modules el specific so that we don't always assume
certain modules are always used. This is necessary because in c9, the
container-tools module is going away.

https://gitlab.com/redhat/centos-stream/release-engineering/pungi-centos/-/merge_requests/176
drops the container-tools module stream from cs9 and
uses non-modular repo to install podman.

Related-Bug: #1949456

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/816318

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie9a40086660bb56bc5528beba7c0d9154b5e6463
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/72/820072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - run: >- if [ '{{ tcib_distro }}' == 'rhel' ]; then {%- if "el" ~ tcib_release in tcib_packages.modules %} {% for item in tcib_packages.modules["el" ~ tcib_release] %}{% set key, value = (item.items() | list).0 %}dnf module -y {{ key }} {{ value }}; {% endfor %} {%- else %} echo "WARNING: No modules defined for el{{ tcib_release}}"; {%- endif %} fi el8: - disable: container-tools:rhel8 - disable: virt:rhel - enable: container-tools:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['container-tools'] | default('3.0') }} - enable: mariadb:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['mariadb'] | default('10.3') }} - enable: virt:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['virt'] | default('av') }} - enable: redis:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['redis'] | default('5') }} el9: - disable: virt:rhel - enable: virt:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['virt'] | default('av') }} - enable: redis:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['redis'] | default('5') }} - enable: mariadb:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['mariadb'] | default('10.5') }}
deleted_lines: - run: if [ '{{ tcib_distro }}' == 'rhel' ]; then {% for item in tcib_packages.modules %}{% set key, value = (item.items() | list).0 %}dnf module -y {{ key }} {{ value }}; {% endfor %}fi - disable: container-tools:rhel8 - disable: virt:rhel - enable: container-tools:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['container-tools'] | default('3.0') }} - enable: mariadb:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['mariadb'] | default('10.3') }} - enable: virt:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['virt'] | default('av') }} - enable: redis:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['redis'] | default('5') }} - enable: nodejs:{{ tcib_rhel_modules['nodejs'] | default('14') }}

commit_message:
tripleo ipa image should use the new ipa-ramdisk

It was pointed out by dtantsur.
dtantsur> heads up, folks, the job
tripleo-buildimage-ironic-python-agent-centos-8
seems to use the old 'ironic-agent' element

Reference:
https://tinyurl.com/yxm4dtcx

Change-Id: I9842dd3dda8d61e478c55a50d886936955c5a7c5

commit_message:
Address some of the non-inclusive language

Non-inclusive language will be removed from
tripleo-heat-templates. This change deprecates
blacklist parameters so that they may be removed
in future releases.

Change-Id: I4820f070cf25829d5212803a47279bfb26b25217

added_lines: local_ca_override_set: {not: {equals: [{get_param: CertmongerCA}, 'local']}} if: - local_ca_override_set - str_replace: template: | # Copy crt and key for backward compatibility cp "/etc/pki/tls/certs/haproxy-external-cert.crt" "CERTSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.crt" cp "/etc/pki/tls/private/haproxy-external-cert.key" "KEYSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.key" ca_path="/etc/ipa/ca.crt" service_crt="CERTSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.crt" service_key="KEYSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.key" service_pem="PEMPATH" cat "$service_crt" "$ca_path" "$service_key" > "$service_pem" container_name=$({{container_cli}} ps --format=\{\{.Names\}\} | grep -w -E 'haproxy(-bundle-.*-[0-9]+)?') # Inject the new pem into the running container if echo "$container_name" | grep -q "^haproxy-bundle"; then # lp#1917868: Do not use podman cp with HA containers as they get # frozen temporarily and that can make pacemaker operation fail. tar -c "$service_pem" | {{container_cli}} exec -i "$container_name" tar -C / -xv # no need to update the mount point, because pacemaker # recreates the container when it's restarted else # Refresh the pem at the mount-point {{container_cli}} cp $service_pem "$container_name:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-tls/$service_pem" # Copy the new pem from the mount-point to the real path {{container_cli}} exec "$container_name" cp "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-tls$service_pem" "$service_pem" fi # Set appropriate permissions {{container_cli}} exec "$container_name" chown haproxy:haproxy "$service_pem" # Trigger a reload for HAProxy to read the new certificates {{container_cli}} kill --signal HUP "$container_name" params: CERTSDIR: {get_param: HAProxyInternalTLSCertsDirectory} KEYSDIR: {get_param: HAProxyInternalTLSKeysDirectory} PEMPATH: {get_param: DeployedSSLCertificatePath} - str_replace: template: | # Copy crt and key for backward compatibility cp "/etc/pki/tls/certs/haproxy-external-cert.crt" "CERTSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.crt" cp "/etc/pki/tls/private/haproxy-external-cert.key" "KEYSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.key" ca_path="/etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem" # Import local CA on renewal to prevent trust break, which can break after a year. openssl pkcs12 -in /var/lib/certmonger/local/creds -out ${ca_path} -nokeys -nodes -passin pass:'' chmod 0644 ${ca_path} update-ca-trust extract service_crt="CERTSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.crt" service_key="KEYSDIR/overcloud-haproxy-external.key" service_pem="PEMPATH" cat "$service_crt" "$ca_path" "$service_key" > "$service_pem" container_name=$({{container_cli}} ps --format=\{\{.Names\}\} | grep -w -E 'haproxy(-bundle-.*-[0-9]+)?') # Inject the new pem into the running container if echo "$container_name" | grep -q "^haproxy-bundle"; then # lp#1917868: Do not use podman cp with HA containers as they get # frozen temporarily and that can make pacemaker operation fail. tar -c "$service_pem" | {{container_cli}} exec -i "$container_name" tar -C / -xv # no need to update the mount point, because pacemaker # recreates the container when it's restarted else # Refresh the pem at the mount-point {{container_cli}} cp $service_pem "$container_name:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-tls/$service_pem" # Copy the new pem from the mount-point to the real path {{container_cli}} exec "$container_name" cp "/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-tls$service_pem" "$service_pem" fi # Set appropriate permissions {{container_cli}} exec "$container_name" chown haproxy:haproxy "$service_pem" # Trigger a reload for HAProxy to read the new certificates {{container_cli}} kill --signal HUP "$container_name" params: CERTSDIR: {get_param: HAProxyInternalTLSCertsDirectory} KEYSDIR: {get_param: HAProxyInternalTLSKeysDirectory} PEMPATH: {get_param: DeployedSSLCertificatePath}

commit_message:
Ensure glance-api services are deployed correctly

This patch adds deploy_steps tasks to catch errors that would
prevent glance-api services from working correctly. The tasks
ensure the deployment fails as early as possible, with an error
message that explains what the user needs to do to correct the
error.

It ensures the GlanceApiInternal service is deployed for roles
that deploy the GlanceApi service. This covers cases where a
deployment is using a custom roles file, and the user overlooked
the release note regarding the need to add the new service when
performing an update.

It also ensures all glance-api services are deployed on the same
network. Allowing the services to be deployed on different networks
would add needless complexity for little gain, so this catches
attempts to customize the ServiceNetMap in a way that would conflict
with that constraint.

Change-Id: I5f88a5938897a516081b7bd9d9972feed157fecd

commit_message:
Glance: Ensure nfs is mounted before starting glance-api

The glance-api service requires that access to NFS backend is ready
before the service is started. This adds systemd service dependency to
enforce that ordering.

Backport note:
This includes commit fdf603173986921578e93c9aaf3a875dfbcf8ce1, which
fixed the wrong format introduced by the original change.

Closes-Bug: #1977991
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839295
Change-Id: Ic4f596a9489d6b9923f55c987e107d33ebb710e7
(cherry picked from commit 88e510415faff86507f825de972a5881a207995c)
(cherry picked from commit 08afb40fae5452a9c57bd1ae7027be4154fc04b5)

commit_message:
Rename bond_interface_ovs_options

Renaming bond_interface_ovs_options variable for consistency
with tripleo-ansible conventions.

This is necessary to add defaults for this variable into the tripleo-ansible
role itself.

subject: Allows configuring unified quotas in nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-10 10:59:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8c066810efea70d53722d7b6c46fba16f19a948b', 'message': "Allows configuring unified quotas in nova

Adding ``NovaEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter to configure unified
quotas in nova.

To make nova unified quotas work, ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id`` needs
to be set in nova.conf, hence adding the ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId``
for the same.

NOTE: The service's endpoint id registered in Keystone will obviously
be not availalbe until the service is up, hence without unified quotas
the correct endpoint id needs to be find first once overcloud is deployed
and then respective THT parameter could be set by enabling unified quotas.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/864196
Change-Id: Ie4c9d3f1c24bac1e4a9f9c21f3ff6b35298028e4

To make nova unified quotas work, ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id`` needs
to be set in nova.conf, hence adding the ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId``
for the same.

NOTE: The service's endpoint id registered in Keystone will obviously
be not availalbe until the service is up, hence without unified quotas
the correct endpoint id needs to be find first once overcloud is deployed
and then respective THT parameter could be set by enabling unified quotas.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/864196
Change-Id: Ie4c9d3f1c24bac1e4a9f9c21f3ff6b35298028e4
"}]
commit_message:
Allows configuring unified quotas in nova

Adding ``NovaEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter to configure unified
quotas in nova.

To make nova unified quotas work, ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id`` needs
to be set in nova.conf, hence adding the ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId``
for the same.

NOTE: The service's endpoint id registered in Keystone will obviously
be not availalbe until the service is up, hence without unified quotas
the correct endpoint id needs to be find first once overcloud is deployed
and then respective THT parameter could be set by enabling unified quotas.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/864196
Change-Id: Ie4c9d3f1c24bac1e4a9f9c21f3ff6b35298028e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/97/864197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added ``NovaEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter, which allows Nova to retrieve limits set in Keystone for resource consumption and enforce those against API users. Also added ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId`` to set ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id``, the nova service's endpoint id which is registered in Keystone.

commit_message:
Octavia: Remove unnecessary neutronclient package

The neutron cli is no longer used since the dependent patch was merged.
Also CentOS/RHEL 7 is no longer supported so the logic for that old
OS version can be removed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/845846
Change-Id: I018811a07283644ae7445c92ced958542f97b0e4
(cherry picked from commit ac5b16012a4f3164c8c607f9960961c7c1810c2e)

commit_message:
Disable client certificate verification on horizon backend.

HAProxy enterprise is needed to use client certificate to communicate with horizon backend [1]. And since haproxy is not configured to use client certificate anyway, the verification on the horizon backend should be disabled

[1] https://www.haproxy.com/documentation/hapee/latest/security/authentication/client-certificate-authentication/

Closes-Bug: #1989667
Change-Id: Ic4aa370ec49ec424e99e7ec68ab9dc39b18b42ac
Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/10/860910/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon::ssl_verify_client: none

commit_message:
Change how ipa principal service names are generated.
Instead of hard-coding `$hostname.$interface.$domain`, now the domain part is retrieved from `network.dns_domain` if set, otherwise defaulting to the previous logic.

Closes-Bug: #1988550
Change-Id: I97bea1f17ed293cce7bc0490e93bb870fa901025
Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>

CtlplaneNetworkAttributes: type: json default: {} description: > A map containing attributes of the undercloud ctlplane network and subnets. NOTE: The value for this parameter is automatically populated in the plan environment by tripleoclient. expression: let(fqdns => $.data.fqdns) -> dict(coalesce($.data.metadata, []).where($ != null and $.type = 'node').groupBy(concat('compact_service_', $.service), $fqdns.get($.network))) data: metadata: {get_attr: [IncomingMetadataSettings, value]} fqdns: {%- for network in networks if network.name == 'ctlplane' or network.name in role.networks %} {%- if network.dns_domain %} {{ network.name_lower }}: {{ network.dns_domain }} {%- else %} {{ network.name_lower }}: str_replace: template: {{ (network.name_lower|replace('_','')) + '.$cloud_domain' }} params: $cloud_domain: { get_param: CloudDomain } {%- endif %} {%- endfor %} ctlplane: { get_param: [CtlplaneNetworkAttributes, network, dns_domain] }

commit_message:
Allow configuring unified quotas in glance.

Adding ``GlanceEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter, to configure
unified quotas in glance.

To make glance unified quotas work, ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id`` is
also needs to be set in glance-api.conf, hence adding the
``GlanceKeystoneEndpointId`` for the same.

NOTE: The service's endpoint id registered in keystone will obviously
      not be available until the service is up, hence without unified
      quotas the correct endpoint id needs to be find first once
      overcloud is deployed and then respective THT parameter could be
      set by enabling the unified quotas.

Depends-on: Ic3d2dc927f4ce2b118ee98811db74e4ac8dfb96a
Change-Id: I804f865624a76292910acc76f192b4ef2ef1fa37

commit_message:
Move host_prep_tasks for octavia worker to Ansible role

This change moves the THT host_prep_tasks for Octavia worker
into the dedicated tripleo_octavia standalone-role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/860333
Change-Id: I637f4567b6fd16df318108da8b9cde8ce1ccf585

added_lines: - name: Run Worker host_prep_tasks include_role: name: tripleo_octavia tasks_from: worker_bootstrap.yml vars: octavia_manage_packages: {get_param: EnablePackageInstall}
deleted_lines: - name: create persistent directories file: path: "{{ item.path }}" state: directory setype: "{{ item.setype }}" mode: "{{ item.mode }}" with_items: - { 'path': /var/log/containers/octavia, 'setype': container_file_t, 'mode': '0750' } - name: Ensure package required for configuring octavia are present package: name: - openssl - python3-openstackclient state: present when: {get_param: EnablePackageInstall} - name: enable virt_sandbox_use_netlink for healthcheck seboolean: name: virt_sandbox_use_netlink persistent: true state: true when: - ansible_facts.selinux is defined - ansible_facts.selinux.status == "enabled"

commit_message:
Move host_prep_tasks for octavia_api

This change moves host_prep_tasks for octavia_api into it's own
standalone-role for tripleo_octavia in line with the wider efforts
around standalone-roles.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/860204
Change-Id: I85107ce5424a102fc454f67f398ec508ec4629b4

deleted_lines: - name: create persistent directories file: path: "{{ item.path }}" state: directory setype: "{{ item.setype }}" mode: "{{ item.mode|default(omit) }}" with_items: - { 'path': /var/log/containers/octavia, 'setype': container_file_t, 'mode': '0750' } - { 'path': /var/log/containers/httpd/octavia-api, 'setype': container_file_t, 'mode': '0750' } - { 'path': /run/octavia, 'setype': container_file_t, 'mode': '0755' } - name: ensure /run/octavia is present upon reboot copy: dest: /etc/tmpfiles.d/run-octavia.conf content: | d /run/octavia 0755 root root - -

commit_message:
Move host_prep_tasks to standalone tripleo_neutron

This change moves the logic contained within host_prep_tasks into
the standalone-role for tripleo_neutron. Additionally, it defines
variables used by the role in group_vars.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/857252
Change-Id: I818ba16f9dbf3b16d7238f7ec86b523864557eca

added_lines: ansible_group_vars: tripleo_neutron_is_http_basic_auth: if: - auth_strategy_http_basic - true - false - - include_role: tripleo_neutron tasks_from: tripleo_neutron_api_install.yml
deleted_lines: - - name: create password file when auth_strategy is 'http_basic' vars: is_http_basic: if: - auth_strategy_http_basic - true - false copy: dest: /etc/neutron_passwd content: str_replace: template: | admin:{{'$ADMIN_PASSWORD' | password_hash('bcrypt')}} neutron:{{'$NEUTRON_PASSWORD' | password_hash('bcrypt')}} ironic:{{'$IRONIC_PASSWORD' | password_hash('bcrypt')}} params: $ADMIN_PASSWORD: {get_param: AdminPassword} $NEUTRON_PASSWORD: {get_param: NeutronPassword} $IRONIC_PASSWORD: {get_param: IronicPassword} when: is_http_basic | bool

commit_message:
Use TLS-e endpoint for ironic-inspector

- Internal endpoints of ironic-inspector are TLS enabled by default. The tls-everywhere-endpoints-dns.yaml should reflect that
- `ironic-api-container-puppet` should format `tripleo_httpd_config_tls_certs` as `httpd-NETWORK`

Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>
Change-Id: I42d78e49c58589319a566b7fde13d3937fcf714f
Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>

deleted_lines: IronicInspectorAdmin: {protocol: 'http', port: '5050', host: 'CLOUDNAME'} IronicInspectorInternal: {protocol: 'http', port: '5050', host: 'CLOUDNAME'}

commit_message:
Fix hard-coded ceph-rgw parameters

According to tripleo-ansible files cephadm uid should default to 167 instead of the hard-coded 472 value.
Introduced t-h-t parameters CephadmUID to manipulate `tripleo_cephadm_uid` in the tripleo-ansible.
Replaced the hard-coded `/etc/ipa/ca.crt` with InternalTLSCAFile parameter

Closes-Bug: #1989831
Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>
Change-Id: Ic3d242a300f2bb89795edf449235c86874decc32
Signed-off-by: Cristian Le <git@lecris.me>

subject: Add handling for Nova multi-rhel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-18 13:44:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4a614439084dacafeb70ad46f623fb4e08986f34', 'message': 'Add handling for Nova multi-rhel

In a Multi-RHEL environment, we need to selectively
choose the correct container image to match the host
OS. This change modifys the ContainerNovaComputeImage
and ContainerNovaLibvirtImage parameters to
allow for a dictionary instead of a string. Then we
template out the docker_config to selectively use
the correct image based on the Host OS.

These values are generated as key/value pairs during
Container Image Prepare step provided by this change:

commit_message:
Add handling for Nova multi-rhel

In a Multi-RHEL environment, we need to selectively
choose the correct container image to match the host
OS. This change modifys the ContainerNovaComputeImage
and ContainerNovaLibvirtImage parameters to
allow for a dictionary instead of a string. Then we
template out the docker_config to selectively use
the correct image based on the Host OS.

These values are generated as key/value pairs during
Container Image Prepare step provided by this change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/853211

We then use tripleo-ansible to select the correct image for the node
based on the OS of the specific node.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/853211
Change-Id: Ia7d57c63d8334efa423e06a125ee17dac0352aca

commit_message:
Remove DnsServers THT parameter

We have used the dns_nameservers from the subnets for
a long time by default: https://review.opendev.org/579582

With network config being applied prior to creating the heat
stack we cannot use a THT parameter to feed the input for
node network configuration. In Wallaby and later the nameservers
must be defined in undercloud.conf using:
  'DEFAULT/undercloud_nameservers'
or
  '%SUBNET_SECTION%/dns_nameservers'

The latter allow defining nameservers per-ctlplane subnet.

Related: RHBZ#2068489
Change-Id: I1c3543d29c57b7b9bdd4e7317fbf0727fa8c4e6c

commit_message:
Make ed25519 deployments work with FIPS

When EnableMysqlAuthEd25519 is used with FIPS, the DB users'
passwords contain binary data. The associated hiera keys hold
base64-encoded values to ease the handling of binary data.

The password part of the database URI has to be encoded with
RFC1738 for oslo.db. Since we can't reuse the base64-encoded
value, use the new <service>PasswordDatabase Heat parameters
to generate the database URI.

Note: we want the <service>PasswordDatabase parameter to hold
the RFC1738-encoded version of the binary password so it can be
stored in a yaml file. In order to prevent Heat's make-url
to encode the password another time, we use a yaql expression
to inject the value of <service>PasswordDatabase into the
generated database URI.

Tested by deploying a standalone, undercloud and HA overcloud
with and without EnableMysqlAuthEd25519.

Closes-Bug: #1960271
Depends-On: Ic7ff36a5f3f4eceeb6c8a338093e956b7db00533
Depends-On: I0b99fac26b2b8eb56e3791511e7869ff8cc3492a
Change-Id: I2e2cd7256700b728453e2b5857967893996cf552

commit_message:
[ovn metadata] Add report agent option

This patch adds support to toggle the liveness report from
the Neutron OVN metadata agent.

Depends-On: Ie66c54a8c20b43bf8359ecad08687290bd422710
Depends-On: Ia996ebee183975b38ca101ca78ee33854051f0a2

Related-Bug: #1931133

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia016e953d147c8ba49f57688b289d13d9f431ee1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/12/796512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - | Add the option to toggle the liveness reports from the ``Neutron OVN metadata agent`` to the server. By default, the reports are enabled.

commit_message:
Bootstrap DB with auth_ed25519 when it is enabled

When DB is bootstrapped at deployment time, DB users
are always created with the default authentication
method, and later moved to using auth_ed25519 when
enabled.

Fix the authentication configuration to always require
auth_ed25519 when enabled.

Related-Bug: #1960271
Change-Id: I2ff418502bd179d2b4955bb783cf7081c35d795c

added_lines: EnableMysqlAuthEd25519: type: boolean description: Whether to configure MySQL users to connect to the server using the Ed25519-based client authentication. default: false ed25519_enabled: {equals: [{get_param: EnableMysqlAuthEd25519}, true]} - if: - ed25519_enabled - - 'mysql -uroot -p"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" -e "ALTER USER ''root''@''localhost'' IDENTIFIED VIA ed25519 USING ''$(python3 /mysql_ed25519_password.py ${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD})'';"' - 'DB_ROOT_PASSWORD=$(echo ${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD} | base64 -d)' - 'mysql -uroot -p$"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" -e "CREATE USER ''clustercheck''@''localhost'' IDENTIFIED VIA ed25519 USING ''$(python3 /mysql_ed25519_password.py ${DB_CLUSTERCHECK_PASSWORD})'';"' - - 'mysql -uroot -p"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" -e "CREATE USER ''clustercheck''@''localhost'' IDENTIFIED BY ''${DB_CLUSTERCHECK_PASSWORD}'';"' - - 'mysql -uroot -p$"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" -e "GRANT PROCESS ON *.* TO ''clustercheck''@''localhost'' WITH GRANT OPTION;"' - 'mysql -uroot -p$"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" -e "DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE user = ''root'' AND host NOT IN (''%'',''localhost'');"' - 'timeout ${DB_MAX_TIMEOUT} mysqladmin -uroot -p$"${DB_ROOT_PASSWORD}" shutdown' - if: - ed25519_enabled - - /etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/files/mysql_ed25519_password.py:/mysql_ed25519_password.py:ro

commit_message:
Allow barbican to configure secure RBAC options

This updates the barbican API container to set the appropriate
configuration options when EnforceSecureRbac is True. This will be
needed when more OpenStack services support system scope and we want to
enable those personas.

Change-Id: Ia935adbbdcabe6a458b6ab9a5c4ac475012ebe17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/77/804277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | A new parameter ``BarbicanEnforceSecureRbac`` has been added to enforce authorization based on common RBAC `personas <https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html#roles-definitions>`_. Enabling this option is only enforce secure RBAC within Barbican's API. Other services will add support for invoking secure RBAC separately.

commit_message:
Add support for RbdStoreChunkSize configuration, defaults to 8MB

Using the same chunk_size for RBD backend in both Cinder and Glance
is especially important when the Ceph cluster is at the Pacific level,
because if they aren't the cluster will return error, also see:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/804265

Change-Id: Ic81d11ba43ed58d0f015c1728c9855b9c2442fbc
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/824520
Closes-Bug: 1957759

added_lines: RbdStoreChunkSize: default: 8 description: > Chunk size, in megabytes, to use for RBD cloning operations. type: number glance::backend::rbd::rbd_store_chunk_size: {get_param: RbdStoreChunkSize}

commit_message:
Fix missing oslo.db options

This ensures that the options from the oslo.db library are picked up
by oslo-config-generator.

Also, update .gitignore so that the sample config file is ignored by
git.

Change-Id: I6ab051fd1c8034d9697b1caab9c1fda64a3275c3

commit_message:
Cinder NVMe-oF new parameters

This patch adds 3 new configuration parameters to cinder's NVMe-oF:

- CinderNVMeOFConnInfoVersion
- CinderNVMeOFShareTarget
- CinderNVMeOFSecondaryIPs

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/877546
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/877545
Change-Id: I6c2e3903af2b086b5421f1649466249f05255a0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/32/877532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Cinder NVMe-oF: Added parameter ``CinderNVMeOFConnInfoVersion`` (defaults to: ``2``) to control the connection information used by the nvmet target. - | Cinder NVMe-oF: Added parameter ``CinderNVMeOFShareTarget`` (defaults to: ``false``) to control whether a single target for each volume or to share a single target for all volumes connected to a host. - | Cinder NVMe-oF: Added parameter ``CinderNVMeOFSecondaryIPs`` (defaults to: ``''``) to control additional IP addresses for the volume to be exported. Used for multipathing and to make single paths more robust.

commit_message:
Revert "Instance HA: prevent compute to start on a host being evacuated"

This reverts commit 9602a9bafc0d6b724aa4228411a8475e23f94efb.

Reason for revert: This was fixed in nova by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/562284/ and that is back-ported to pike which is one release further back then on the tripleo side so this should be removed as it prevent compute form starting if there is a network outage.

Change-Id: I99beab9b5fcc76298d433241c7b1425c59e4b6f9

commit_message:
mlnx: Set dhcp_broadcase_reply consistently

Recent puppet-neutron change fixed the duplicate resource declaration,
but this requires the parameter is set consistently accross multiple
classes.

Also, there already is the NeutronDhcpServerBroadcastReply parameter to
set the same parameter in dhcp agent. We should not internally override
it but honor this parameter.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/854292
Change-Id: Ib01a7274c15b711cc01ef00190bbf4229d13cff8
(cherry picked from commit 59da4b543e9cb92df879e4711b216b9d91ba55f1)

added_lines: NeutronDhcpServerBroadcastReply: true

commit_message:
Glance: Ensure nfs is mounted before starting glance-api

The glance-api service requires that access to NFS backend is ready
before the service is started. This adds systemd service dependency to
enforce that ordering.

Backport note:
This includes commit fdf603173986921578e93c9aaf3a875dfbcf8ce1, which
fixed the wrong format introduced by the original change.

Closes-Bug: #1977991
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/839295
Change-Id: Ic4f596a9489d6b9923f55c987e107d33ebb710e7
(cherry picked from commit 88e510415faff86507f825de972a5881a207995c)

subject: Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-04 13:53:19.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/neutron/kill-script'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/dfd35061a1c06c13434fcfcd6871a249916e9862', 'message': 'Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron sidecar containers in more reliable way

Previously kill-script used by Neutron agents to kill sidecar
containers was sending TERM signal to container when it was going to be
closed with SIGTERM. After that it was immediatelly trying to remove
container with "podman rm" command.
Sometimes, if container wasn't really stopped yet when "podman rm" was
used, removal of container failed and there was leftover sidecar on the
host.
Now kill-script will instead use "podman stop" command which will send
TERM to the container and wait some time (10 seconds by default) until
it will be really stopped before it will try to delete container.

Additionally this patch improves logging in different functions in
kill-script.

Closes: rhbz#2080811
Change-Id: If893bb6883843bea48c50c47b98f182cacdd50b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/71/879471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: add_date "Killing container $1 ($2)" signal_container $1 $2 9 } stop_container() { delete_container $CT_NAME $CT_ID stop_container $CT_NAME $CT_ID

commit_message:
Add Mysql WSREP SST method override

Add Mysql WSREP SST method override .  Some customers have been using
mariabackup since 2019 without any issues and we have no ways of
overriding this.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/818776
Change-Id: I8a52bf43c01d0471cedc796437dde1deb4c25bdf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/818779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MysqlWsrepSstMethod: default: '' type: string description: > Specify the MySQL WSREP SST method used for syncing cluster constraints: - allowed_values: ['rsync', 'rsync_tunnel', 'mariabackup', ''] - if: - {get_param: MysqlWsrepSstMethod} - tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::wsrep_sst_method: {get_param: MysqlWsrepSstMethod} - null - tripleo::profile::pacemaker::database::mysql_bundle::bind_address:

commit_message:
Validate no services are disabled in pacemaker

Validate no services are disabled in pacemaker especially pacemaker
remote service as the configuration steps will timeout after a few
hours if for some reasons the services are disabled and a stack
deploy is ran.

Change-Id: I3c58a23d26708a1bbe00022cb2d29e577e929f27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/845354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host_prep_tasks: - name: Validate pacemaker cluster is healthy command: pcs status | grep -q "Stopped (disabled)" register: pcs_status when: {get_param: EnableInstanceHA} - name: Fail when services are disabled fail: msg: Some services are disabled when they're expected to be enabled, next step will timeout when: - {get_param: EnableInstanceHA} - pcs_status.rc == 0

Use ceph_mon in ceph-mon.yaml instead of ceph_osd

It looks like we are using tripleo.collectd.plugins.ceph_osd instead
of tripleo.collectd.plugins.ceph_mon for the mon collectd plugins.

commit_message:
Adds env file to specify larger size for CinderLVMLoopDeviceSize

We are doing this because periodic standalone full tempest api compute fails test tempest.api.volume.test_volumes_snapshots.VolumesSnapshotTestJSON as cinder's LVM backend is running out of space.

Related-Bug: #1864652
Change-Id: I8e185cd6702c73b4adccf28e091427d8ed0a5cde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/48/885248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameter_defaults: CinderLVMLoopDeviceSize: 20560

commit_message:
Do not disable nova-compute service if it's not enabled

Do not disable nova-compute service if it's not enabled as this playbook
just fails if a nova-compute service is already disabled.  This works
well when scaling up / down nodes that are enabled but lamentably fails
if an operator actually disabled the service before ...

Change-Id: I812b64ca003e82b089f6f554174c46f511000bee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/13/881913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: block - name: Validate nova-compute is enabled command: openstack compute service list --host {{ nova_compute_service[0].Host }} --service nova-compute -f value -c Status | grep -q enabled delegate_to: "{{ groups['Undercloud'] | first }}" check_mode: false when: - not is_additional_cell|bool changed_when: nova_compute_service_state.rc != 0 register: nova_compute_service_state - not is_additional_cell|bool and ('rc' in nova_compute_service_state and nova_compute_service_state.rc == 0)

commit_message:
Setup internal undercloud registry during external_deploy_tasks_step0

This change is needed to allow services like frr (deployed via
pre_deploy_step_tasks) to have their images automatically pulled
and saved to the internal registry before their deployment.

Without this change the frr container is not pulled/pushed to the
undercloud registry and we need to explicitly add the external location
via ContainerFrrImage for things to work as expected.

Change-Id: I3974fdc2c64b0bceb0afbab497b9540a4fff1b3b

commit_message:
Manage CA certificates using ansible

This change introduces a new implementation to manage CA certificate
files by ansible, which replaces the existing one by puppet.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/743620
Change-Id: I241f3d635e36a1497a1146fdd4c1db7dfde28dc8
(cherry picked from commit f3ac1f9762f40af995b2026d20488775a7d65eca)

added_lines: upgrade: - | Puppet implementation to manage CA certificates has been replaced by Ansible implementation. Deployment templates should be updated to use the new template file (-baremetal-ansible.yaml) during update.

commit_message:
Octavia: skip external deploy tasks if no nodes

Under some conditions, octavia environment files might be included in
a command line without any roles with octavia amphora controllers in
the list of services. This causes a problem in the generation of the
octavia inventory. This patch will cause an empty inventory to be
generated so none of the external tasks are run if there are no
octavia components included in the current deployment.

Change-Id: I75e67445dfc78c9525cff3999d3e409c9120e70c

subject: Ensure that the mysql is started before migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-08-10 09:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/undercloud/undercloud-upgrade.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ae934d14c987fc9708c637b03ddaabf1fd46e380', 'message': 'Ensure that the mysql is started before migration

Currently the migration from swift to database
is happening without checking that the DB is started.
When the undercloud upgrade fails, there is a high
chance that the mysql is stopped, so the operator
needs to start the tripleo_mysql service before doing
another "openstack undercloud upgrade".
This patch ensure that the tripleo_mysql service is

Change-Id: Ib9c39deb8af9e222ad10e15fd9b01416cf4f38ec
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the mysql is started before migration

Currently the migration from swift to database
is happening without checking that the DB is started.
When the undercloud upgrade fails, there is a high
chance that the mysql is stopped, so the operator
needs to start the tripleo_mysql service before doing
another "openstack undercloud upgrade".
This patch ensure that the tripleo_mysql service is
started before doing the ironic migration.

Change-Id: Ib9c39deb8af9e222ad10e15fd9b01416cf4f38ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/21/891021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ensure mysql is started systemd: name: tripleo_mysql.service state: started when: - step|int == 1

commit_message:
Run Swift replicators in single replica mode

This makes sure we still run the replicators in single replica mode.
Besides replication they also do some cleanup like removing old
tombstone files.

However, it is not needed to run them all the time, thus setting an
interval between runs of 1 day.

Closes-Bug: 1907062
Change-Id: I4dface059e193c5c0769f7d80293ff5fff7d2653
(cherry picked from commit 9be1b7746154d29b34b3106837cccafc0f3b6f29)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Enable Swift replicators in single replica mode to ensure cleanup of old tombstone (.ts) files. Sleep interval between replication runs is set to 24 hours to prevent unneeded load on the systems if no replication is needed.

commit_message:
Allow an operator to install IDM without TLS-e

As it is, if an operator installs IPA on all their hosts, keystone
with the LDAP backend will break because it lists a TLS certificate
that isn't available in the keystone container.  This patch allows
any operator to tell THT that IPA is installed and that the volume
should be presented.

Change-Id: I5abf3674ae612c4a6e7fa5072d0adbc5f4c260e0

Introduce new parameters "CeilometerEnableCaching"
and "CeilometerCachingBackend" to configure caching in Ceilometer.

This change sets "oslo_cache.dict" as the default caching backend.

Ceilometer requires caching after 69133858e55a81c0fbc104a0e90f3d6d20c8b76f
was introduced which captures project/user name fields by querying

Keystone api with such requests.

Change-Id: I59c8c142af01189b4d2a399f5c32733dbcc163e5
'}]
commit_message:
Set default caching backend in ceilometer

Introduce new parameters "CeilometerEnableCaching"
and "CeilometerCachingBackend" to configure caching in Ceilometer.

This change sets "oslo_cache.dict" as the default caching backend.

Ceilometer requires caching after 69133858e55a81c0fbc104a0e90f3d6d20c8b76f
was introduced which captures project/user name fields by querying
Keystone. With caching enabled, Ceilometer will avoid overwhelming
Keystone api with such requests.

Change-Id: I59c8c142af01189b4d2a399f5c32733dbcc163e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/60/896660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CeilometerEnableCaching: default: true description: Enable caching type: boolean CeilometerCachingBackend: default: "oslo_cache.dict" description: Set caching backend type: string ceilometer::cache::enabled: {get_param: CeilometerEnableCaching} ceilometer::cache::backend: {get_param: CeilometerCachingBackend}

commit_message:
[ffwd3] Do not shut down pacemaker during upgrade

We do not shut down whole pacemaker cluster but we only
shut down services if the image retag and switch is needed.

Resolves: rhbz#2247606

Change-Id: I2f1d0a0c6d0103de17b6c3b8aa38b01dc3ca6f80

commit_message:
[S-RBAC] Adopt net_owner_member rule in the subnet policies

Similar change was done in Neutron with [1] to fix bug where network
owner even with just reader role was able to create/update/delete
subnet.
This patch introduces the same fix in the custom S-RBAC policies for
Neutron in TripleO.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/886231

Closes-BZ: #2247158
Change-Id: If8f431c698005cebf24c48e302f23d555fae6358

commit_message:
Use the network name and pick subnet_id from subnet_ids

Use the network name and pick subnet_id from subnet_ids as some
operators have repeating subnet names but no network names.

This will fix the following error:
```
2023-11-02 15:52:26.572376 | 5254009a-8986-d38c-8bcc-000000018786 |   FATAL | Create a neutron port for a new address | undercloud | error={"changed": false, "extra_data": {"data": null, "details": "Invalid input for operation: Failed to create port on network 4241be4a-437a-4a10-8825-3ddd26993d23, because fixed_ips included invalid subnet da79981d-ec7e-4de0-967f-6872a5b82c6e.", "response": "{\"NeutronError\": {\"type\": \"InvalidInput\", \"message\": \"Invalid input for operation: Failed to create port on network 4241be4a-437a-4a10-8825-3ddd26993d23, because fixed_ips included invalid subnet da79981d-ec7e-4de0-967f-6872a5b82c6e.\", \"detail\": \"\"}}"}, "msg": "BadRequestException: 400: Client Error for url: https://10.10.10.10:13696/v2.0/ports, Invalid input for operation: Failed to create port on network 4241be4a-437a-4a10-8825-3ddd26993d23, because fixed_ips included invalid subnet da79981d-ec7e-4de0-967f-6872a5b82c6e.
Change-Id: Id195be06b9e0c53604a4508c7106e79504060d48
```
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/09/901609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
