commit_message:
Add support for northd --n-threads

OVN 22.06 and later support the --n-threads northd option.
Less resource constrained clusters can use up to 4 northd
threads for better network operation latency at the cost
of a bit of extra CPU usage.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/902163
Change-Id: I88eb743a594756d5c2280997c08b54e298251b49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/64/902164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVNNorthdThreads: description: Number of threads to use for ovn-northd type: number default: 4 tripleo_ovn_cluster_northd_threads: {get_param: OVNNorthdThreads}

commit_message:
Only perform IHA scale down taks when necessary

Let's avoid running the crm_node command when there is no
pacemaker_remote service running, otherwise it will error out with:

[root@compute-0 ~]# crm_node -n
error: Could not connect to controller: Connection refused

In addition, let's check if we are running these commands on a compute
node by checking if its hostname is in the
compute_instanceha_short_node_names list to filter out any eventual
composable-ha node running pacemaker_remote.

Resolves: rhbz#2251805
Change-Id: Ie3e69378bfeb6359a0cb14ae3b3fb70874a0df7a

This commit fixes this.

collectd containers need access to ipmi

collectd containers need access to ipmi and this requires /dev/ipmi0 and
privileged permissoins.

commit_message:
Add ceph version validation during FFU

This patch adds validation task before 'rolling_update'
and 'adoption' playbooks during FFU.

Validation task will ensure that RHCS6(quincy) image is not
used.

commit_message:
Mount host's ipmi device node into collectd container

Mount "/dev/ipmi0" as device into collectd container which is
necessary for ipmi plugin to work. This device is only added if
`EnableSTF` is set to true because that's when ipmi plugin is enabled.

Change-Id: I489192ec09379f214c1b87a309a3c1135201198b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/50/907950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device: - if: - enable_stf - "/dev/ipmi0" deploy_steps_tasks: - name: Check if /dev/ipmi0 exists when: - {get_param: EnableSTF} - step|int == 3 block: - stat: path: /dev/ipmi0 register: ipmi_device - set_fact: add_ipmi_path: '/dev/ipmi0' when: ipmi_device.stat.exists

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I1cbcf97fb96375c48030a6b3f839601664654cab

commit_message:
Get OVS DB query results

This change adds output of a few ovs-vsctl commands, so that we can
review objects in OVS DB such as bridge and port, and configurations in
the other_config column.

Change-Id: I1ce8696a181721eea32f4119917891bc98b811f3

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I4d47517c421e89b45779623bddf37769f293df9b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-openstack-operations refs/changes/53/732753/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix busybox portability

Some of the find arguments we use are not available on busybox and
therefore we cannot support creation of busybox images without chaning
them.

Change-Id: I4062696209e0750e95d0a1c697af271be6a07052

commit_message:
Correct the tox option for skipping sdist generation

The tox option to skip source distribution building is skipsdist,
but this seems to be often misspelled skipdist instead, which gets
silently ignored and so does not take effect. Correct it
everywhere, in hopes that new projects will finally stop copying
this mistake around.

See https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-skipsdist
and https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/1388 for details.

Change-Id: Id5930849c9537218d933002c11d603fb76dd2d69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image refs/changes/04/796904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: skipsdist = True

commit_message:
Remove python-dev from bindep

It is no longer supported by jammy and lead us to the following errors with the announce-release job.

```
No package matching 'python-dev' is available
```

Change-Id: I77c5923e6cad98921f4fa4142b197e24d56a11d3

commit_message:
Fixes on tripleo_deploy role

* According to this [1] change, the `openstack tripleo deploy` command is used
only to deploy standalone environment, so it's useless to have a
boolean to set it on or off

* According to this [2] change, '--standalone' flag has been removed for `openstack tripleo deploy`
  command [2]

* Fix molecule tests

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/852379
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/753447

Change-Id: I18dd339fa3c943465ca5ef0dba490ae81e80cf02

commit_message:
Provide a playbook example to deploy minions

This patch aims to provide an example of an Ansible
playbook which will take care of deploying an Undercloud
minion with the tripleo-operator-ansible project.

Change-Id: I889a929b25f1d3822757d88e3381952252ab0eb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible refs/changes/68/740268/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- ############################################################################### # Undercloud minions installation playbook # # Description: # This is a basic playbook to install undercloud minions on an already # provisioned system. # ############################################################################### - hosts: minions collections: - tripleo.operator vars: install_debug: true minion_hostname: 'minion.localdomain' minion_local_mtu: 1400 minion_local_interface: eth1 minion_enable_selinux: true # According to the doc it is highly recommended to leave this value set to true unless you are debugging an issue. tasks: - name: Set hostname hostname: name: "{{ minion_hostname }}" become: true - name: Configure tripleo repositories include_role: name: tripleo_repos - name: Ensure system is up to date yum: name: '*' state: latest register: packages_updated become: true - name: Reboot if necessary reboot: become: true when: packages_updated is changed - name: Install tripleoclient block: - name: install python tripleoclient yum: name: python2-tripleoclient state: installed become: true when: ansible_distribution_major_version|int <= 7 - name: install python3 tripleoclient package: name: python3-tripleoclient state: present become: true when: ansible_distribution_major_version|int >= 8 #5.4 - name: Copying the undercloud output file to the minion copy: src: ~/tripleo-undercloud-outputs.yaml dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/tripleo-undercloud-outputs.yaml" remote_src: false - name: Copying the undercloud password file to the minion copy: src: ~/tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/tripleo-undercloud-passwords.yaml" remote_src: false #5.5 - name: copy: src: /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem dest: /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/cm-local-ca.pem remote_src: false - name: Copy sample minion.conf copy: src: /usr/share/python-tripleoclient/minion.conf.sample dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" remote_src: true - name: Configure minion.conf ini_file: path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" section: "{{ item.section }}" option: "{{ item.option }}" value: "{{ item.value }}" loop: - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_debug', 'value': "{{ install_debug }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_local_mtu', 'value': "{{ minion_local_mtu }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_local_interface', 'value': "{{ minion_local_interface }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'minion_enable_selinux', 'value': "{{ minion_enable_selinux }}"} - {'section': 'DEFAULT', 'option': 'container_images_file', 'value': '/home/stack/containers-prepare-parameter.yaml'} # Example configuration copy/modification with config_template module # (https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-config_template) # # - name: Configure minion.conf # config_template: # src: /usr/share/python-tripleoclient/minion.conf.sample # dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/minion.conf" # remote_src: true # render_template: false # config_type: ini # config_overrides: # 'DEFAULT': # minion_debug: "{{ install_debug }}" # minion_local_mtu: "{{ minion_local_mtu }}" # minion_local_interface: "{{ minion_local_interface }}" # minion_enable_selinux: "{{ minion_enable_selinux }}" - name: Install minion include_role: name: tripleo_undercloud_minion_install vars: tripleo_minion_install_debug: "{{ install_debug }}"

commit_message:
replacing controller nodes playbook

This is a basic playbook to automate the process of replacing controller nodes.

It stops the pacemaker on the old node, deletes the old node from pacemaker cluster,
removes node from list of known hosts in pacemaker, ensures pacemaker does not stop
Galera during replacement, determines heat resource ID, creates an enviroment file,
sets node to maintenance mode, and runs overcloud deploy.

Change-Id: I4b729255c7684f6f365e7c470f21c345cae467f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-operator-ansible refs/changes/46/771446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- ############################################################################### # Replacing Controller Nodes Playbook # # Description: # This is a basic playbook to automate the process of replacing controller # nodes. # ############################################################################### - hosts: undercloud collections: - tripleo.operator vars: bootstrapnode: overcloud-controller-0 oldnode: overcloud-controller-1 node_debug: true node_introspect: true node_environment_source_json_file: /home/stack/templates/remove-controller.yaml deploy_debug: true deploy_templates: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/ deploy_controller_count: 3 deploy_compute_count: 3 deploy_dns: - 1.1.1.1 - 8.8.8.8 deploy_ntp: - 0.pool.ntp.org - 1.pool.ntp.org - 2.pool.ntp.org - 3.pool.ntp.org deploy_env_files: - /home/stack/templates/remove-controller.yaml - "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/remove-controller.yaml" tasks: - os_server_info: cloud: undercloud server: "{{ oldnode }}" register: oldnode_info - name: Stop Pacemaker on oldnode command: "sudo pcs cluster stop {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: Delete the old node from the pacemaker cluster command: "sudo pcs cluster node remove {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: remove node from list of known hosts in pacemaker command: "sudo pcs host deauth {{ oldnode }}" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: ensure Pacemaker does not stop Galera during replacement procedure command: "sudo pcs resource unmanage galera-bundle" delegate_to: "{{ bootstrapnode }}" - name: Determine the heat resource ID of the node to remove shell: | source ~/stackrc openstack stack resource show overcloud ControllerServers -f json -c attributes | jq -c '.attributes.value | keys[] as $k | if .[$k] == "{{ oldnode_info.openstack_servers[0].id }}" then $k else empty end' register: oldnode_index - name: Create Environment file copy: content: | parameter_defaults: ControllerRemovalPolicies: [{'resource_list': [{{ oldnode_index.stdout }}] }] dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/remove-controller.yaml" mode: '0644' - name: Set the node to maintenance mode shell: | source ~/stackrc INSTANCE=$(openstack server list --name {{ oldnode }} -f value -c ID) NODE=$(openstack baremetal node list -f csv --quote minimal | grep $INSTANCE | cut -f1 -d,) openstack baremetal node maintenance set $NODE - name: Run overcloud deployment include_role: name: tripleo_overcloud_deploy vars: tripleo_overcloud_deploy_debug: "{{ deploy_debug }}" tripleo_overcloud_deploy_environment_files: "{{ deploy_env_files }}" tripleo_overcloud_deploy_templates: "{{ deploy_templates }}"

commit_message:
Ensure /etc/multipath.conf exists

An error is being logged in early boot because
there is no /etc/multipath.conf in the initramfs so multipath
blacklists every multipath device.

This change generates a default /etc/multipath.conf which will be
added to the initramfs during the dracut regenerate.

Change-Id: I60bf607111cb583ef33de19520757c96296d0f79
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/00/838600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux set -o pipefail # Make sure there is a multipath.conf which enables all devices by default if [[ ! -e /etc/multipath.conf ]]; then mpathconf --enable fi

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ib6aef74a409d728078c4c199806fda60447fb49c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/40/862540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | The seven LVM volumes in the overcloud-hardened-uefi-full image are now thinly provisioned, backed by a single pool. The initial boot growvols behaviour is now to grow the pool to the size of the disk and grow each thin provisioned volume so the capacity of the pool is filled but not over provisioned. This will allow temporary volumes to be created for backups during upgrades, and it will allow the operator to over-provision a volume which requires extra capacity.

commit_message:
Fix the outdated links in metadata

- Now the project is hosted under the openstack org

- The project page and issues are now found in launchpad

- opendev git should be used instead of github, which is a mirror now.

Change-Id: Id267c9814621e26e53cfd035d8e9b79d16c56584

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper

This change replaces a few core files such as spec_helper by the common
implementation in puppet-openstack_spec_helper, so that we don't need
to maintain the different implementation in this repository. This
allows us to fix the broken library installation in CentOS 9 Stream.

Because of this change, acceptance tests now uses litmus instead of
beaker, following the transition in the Puppet OpenStack project. Note
the acceptance tests are not actually used in CI. We probably want to
add litmus jobs to run these tests but these are left as a future work
now.

Also, fixed the manifests to adapt to a few more lint plugins enabled.
The example manifests are updated, to avoid failure in
the check_absolute_classname lint plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/863187
Change-Id: I43c41103672de99a928807fe69fe3ee8a0274ec7

subject: Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-04-13 13:15:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/630305dddf9198ef1fddfc66d2ee9f4d456dfde6', 'message': 'Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function

Currently we get the following error:

  1) pcmk_common functions pcmk_restart_resource? stonith resource
     Failure/Error: expect(pcmk_restart_resource?('stonith-fence_ipmilan-stonith-fence-1', "cib-resource.xml")).to eq true

       expected: true
            got: false

       (compared using ==)

       Diff:
       @@ -1 +1 @@
       -true
       +false

     # ./spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb:41:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output.

The problem in CI is that crm_simulate output slightly changed and so
one test is failing. Since it makes no sense to call
pacemaker_restart_resource? with a working crm_diff (i.e. any pacemaker
> 1.1.18-12), we just make sure we do not run these tests on a working
crm_diff.

We plan to remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton (and
el7) is unsupported, so this change is a minimal non-invasive fix for
the time being.

Closes-Bug: #1921118

Change-Id: Ic8a8e127004220bb8b6735b6cf8b4b52c03fa825
(cherry picked from commit 531283ecea579bf0576bd515770d9cf6513e48c7)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-05-31 05:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/puppet/provider/cib-orig.xml', '.zuul.yaml', 'Gemfile', 'spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/bde7605382d1503647b537cd9c80bdb28729201b', 'message': 'Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function

Currently we get the following error:

  1) pcmk_common functions pcmk_restart_resource? stonith resource
     Failure/Error: expect(pcmk_restart_resource?('stonith-fence_ipmilan-stonith-fence-1', "cib-resource.xml")).to eq true

       expected: true
            got: false

       (compared using ==)

       Diff:
       @@ -1 +1 @@
       -true
       +false

     # ./spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb:41:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output.

The problem in CI is that crm_simulate output slightly changed and so
one test is failing. Since it makes no sense to call
pacemaker_restart_resource? with a working crm_diff (i.e. any pacemaker
> 1.1.18-12), we just make sure we do not run these tests on a working
crm_diff.

We plan to remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton (and
el7) is unsupported, so this change is a minimal non-invasive fix for
the time being.

Backport note:
This also includes Change I2a2250894c8c9a881120983897c22c491b2e012d
to unblock CI. Note that this contains a few adjustments because
of old codebase.

- mocha is pinned to an older version because 2.0.x requires Ruby
  2.7.1 and later. This was done in stable/1.5.0 and later by [1]
- This also fixes the broken unit tests which was later fixed by [2].

[1] I5144d738f53d127a4d306a47777e381873672d56
[2] I8f5c04cea4afb8f46a8da5ab639ac984bac36cca

Closes-Bug: #1921118

Change-Id: Ic8a8e127004220bb8b6735b6cf8b4b52c03fa825
(cherry picked from commit 531283ecea579bf0576bd515770d9cf6513e48c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix spec tests using the deprecated pacemaker_restart_resource? function

Currently we get the following error:

  1) pcmk_common functions pcmk_restart_resource? stonith resource
     Failure/Error: expect(pcmk_restart_resource?('stonith-fence_ipmilan-stonith-fence-1', "cib-resource.xml")).to eq true

       expected: true
            got: false

       (compared using ==)

       Diff:
       @@ -1 +1 @@
       -true
       +false

     # ./spec/unit/puppet/provider/pcmk_common_spec.rb:41:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

Reason for this is that there are two functions to detect a change in a
pcmk resource:
- pacemaker_restart_resource? -> which parses crm_simulate and was
  necessary due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561617
  (Fixed in pacemaker-1.1.18-12)
- pacemaker_restart_resource_ng? -> which is the preferred one and uses
  crm_diff xml output.

The problem in CI is that crm_simulate output slightly changed and so
one test is failing. Since it makes no sense to call
pacemaker_restart_resource? with a working crm_diff (i.e. any pacemaker
> 1.1.18-12), we just make sure we do not run these tests on a working
crm_diff.

We plan to remove pacemaker_restart_resource? fully now that newton (and
el7) is unsupported, so this change is a minimal non-invasive fix for
the time being.

Backport note:
This also includes Change I2a2250894c8c9a881120983897c22c491b2e012d
to unblock CI. Note that this contains a few adjustments because
of old codebase.

- mocha is pinned to an older version because 2.0.x requires Ruby
  2.7.1 and later. This was done in stable/1.5.0 and later by [1]
- This also fixes the broken unit tests which was later fixed by [2].

[1] I5144d738f53d127a4d306a47777e381873672d56
[2] I8f5c04cea4afb8f46a8da5ab639ac984bac36cca

Closes-Bug: #1921118

Change-Id: Ic8a8e127004220bb8b6735b6cf8b4b52c03fa825
(cherry picked from commit 531283ecea579bf0576bd515770d9cf6513e48c7)

commit_message:
Stable-only: Stop testing with stable/zed

The stable/zed branch of TripleO repos is no longer maintained. This
removes the tests with stable/zed contents to remove tests with
the unmaintained branch.

Change-Id: I376f80b0585d562a3bdaa07b1e565f59a010f1e0

added_lines: # composable_scenario: multinode-containers.yaml # composable_services: false # # network_isolation: false # enable_pacemaker: false # overcloud_ipv6: false # containerized_overcloud: true containerized_undercloud: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike','queens'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_templates_path: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates undercloud_custom_env_files: "{{ working_dir }}/undercloud-parameter-defaults.yaml" undercloud_cloud_domain: "localdomain" undercloud_undercloud_hostname: "undercloud.{{ undercloud_cloud_domain }}" # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false # This enables the deployment of the overcloud with SSL. ssl_overcloud: false # Tell tripleo about our environment. enable_pacemaker: true network_isolation: true network_isolation_type: "single-nic-vlans" composable_roles: true overcloud_roles: - name: Controller CountDefault: 1 tags: - primary - controller networks: - External - InternalApi - Storage - StorageMgmt - Tenant - name: Compute CountDefault: 1 tags: - compute networks: - External - InternalApi - Storage - StorageMgmt - Tenant deployed_server: >- {% if release in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} deploy_steps_ansible_workflow: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} config_download_args: >- {% if release in ['queens'] -%} -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml --config-download --deployed-server {%- endif %} {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} -e {{ working_dir }}/config-download.yaml --disable-validations {%- endif -%} ephemeral_heat: "{{ (release not in ['queens', 'stein','train','ussuri','victoria']) | bool }}" ephemeral_heat_args: "{{ '--heat-type pod' if ephemeral_heat|bool else '' }}" extra_args: >- {%- if release not in ['train','ussuri','victoria'] -%} --disable-protected-resource-types {%- endif -%} # Tempest configuration, keep always at the end of the file test_ping: false # Settings for os_tempest use_os_tempest: >- {% if release not in ['pike', 'queens', 'stein'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} tempest_test_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps' test_white_regex: 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops' # https://launchpad.net/bugs/1844446 undercloud_enable_validations: false undercloud_enable_paunch: false

commit_message:
Enable use of yum-config module in master branch

This patch enables the use yum-config module, in master branch, to setup
some of the repos inside repo-setup role.

Change-Id: I02b378550552f0564dc5519d234ecae1c4ae2bc8
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/95/817295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Save environment variables, to be used afterwards echo "export NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY=${NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY}" >> {{ repo_setup_env_filepath }} echo "export RDO_DLRN_REPO=${RDO_DLRN_REPO}" >> {{ repo_setup_env_filepath }} # Try to setup repos using yum-config module if available use_yum_config_module: true

commit_message:
Add note about project deprecation

TripleO project has been deprecated and the master branch is no longer
developed. Also stable/zed has no maintainers now.

This adds the warning to explain that point clearly to users.

Change-Id: I55878b89af6c5cf6706ac26aecbed9a640826586

commit_message:
Remove conditionals when configuring docker_registry_host

In CloudSIG jobs we always need to build our own containers. Also we
currently don't use consumer jobs so we can clean up that logic.

Change-Id: I30f7f7026eca49732028b411592578288866d6bc

commit_message:
DNM Add temporary repo with ansible-collections-openstack 2.0.0 preview

This patch is adding a new temporary repo which contains a package for
a-o-c 2.0.0 preview and python3-openstacksdk-0.101.0 which is current
u-c version.

It also indludes logic from [1] to install different versions of a-c-o
from galaxy depending on the version of openstack.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/843497/

Change-Id: I436d79d79e206dbc3eccba382e34199178be2afb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/70/861170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install ansible-collections-openstack separately to account for different releases ACO_BRANCH=master if [[ $QUICKSTART_RELEASE =~ .*(train|victoria|wallaby).* ]]; then ACO_BRANCH=stable/1.0.0 fi if [[ -d ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack ]]; then # Install zuul-cloned repo pushd ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack git checkout $ACO_BRANCH ansible-galaxy collection install --force . \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections popd else ansible-galaxy collection install --force \ git+https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack,$ACO_BRANCH \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections fi OS_COLLECTIONS="ansible-config_template tripleo-operator-ansible"

commit_message:
Skip restarting one-short containers unnecessarily

Currently containers without restart: true flag is always started
during deployment, because PodmanManager tries to start an existing
container even if its definition is not updated.

This introduces the pre-check to avoid that redundant execution of
the container. Containers without restart: true should be re-executed
only when container definition (eg. TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH environment)
is changed. In case a specific container should be executed in every
deployment attempt then that can be enforced by adding
the TRIPLEO_DEPLOYMENT_IDENTIFIER environment.

Change-Id: If4ce603c432f7790c8f247af76fa469054d38d6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/02/880702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: manager = PodmanManager(self.module, container_opts) if manager.recreate or manager.container.different: manager.execute()

subject: parse_ansible_inventory: use ansible_runner instead of importing Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-03 02:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_admin.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v2/overcloud_ceph.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/test_overcloud_admin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/2007f38df7d049b7a2942900eda2c0eb7c2cdcfa', 'message': "parse_ansible_inventory: use ansible_runner instead of importing Ansible

All our interactions with Ansible are brokered by the ansible_runner
module, except for this one function which imports the Ansible module
proper. This leads for breakage when using the latest Ansible builds
from EL9, which are on python3.11 instead of 3.9.

By refactoring parse_ansible_inventory to use ansible_runner's
get_inventory we avoid that breakage, but we also lose out on the
pattern matching as that isn't supported. This function is called in two
places:

ceph_hosts_in_inventory: it didn't do any pattern matching at all, so it
isn't impacted by the change.

overcloud admin authorize: we can now offload the pattern matching to
Ansible itself via the limit_hosts parameter we pass to the playbook run
command, preserving the original functionality.

Closes-Bug: #2007659
Change-Id: I08330ced3b31d0ff48a881501cae8bd726e36432
(cherry picked from commit 4d8fe985e0992bc93c048507fd78075058146e07)
(cherry picked from commit 279ab405e2858571fee558a6435218a8747e7afe)
"}]
commit_message:
parse_ansible_inventory: use ansible_runner instead of importing Ansible

All our interactions with Ansible are brokered by the ansible_runner
module, except for this one function which imports the Ansible module
proper. This leads for breakage when using the latest Ansible builds
from EL9, which are on python3.11 instead of 3.9.

By refactoring parse_ansible_inventory to use ansible_runner's
get_inventory we avoid that breakage, but we also lose out on the
pattern matching as that isn't supported. This function is called in two
places:

ceph_hosts_in_inventory: it didn't do any pattern matching at all, so it
isn't impacted by the change.

overcloud admin authorize: we can now offload the pattern matching to
Ansible itself via the limit_hosts parameter we pass to the playbook run
command, preserving the original functionality.

Closes-Bug: #2007659
Change-Id: I08330ced3b31d0ff48a881501cae8bd726e36432
(cherry picked from commit 4d8fe985e0992bc93c048507fd78075058146e07)
(cherry picked from commit 279ab405e2858571fee558a6435218a8747e7afe)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/17/876217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: limit_hosts='localhost,overcloud',

Closes-Bug: #2007659
Change-Id: I08330ced3b31d0ff48a881501cae8bd726e36432
(cherry picked from commit 4d8fe985e0992bc93c048507fd78075058146e07)

commit_message:
parse_ansible_inventory: use ansible_runner instead of importing Ansible

All our interactions with Ansible are brokered by the ansible_runner
module, except for this one function which imports the Ansible module
proper. This leads for breakage when using the latest Ansible builds
from EL9, which are on python3.11 instead of 3.9.

By refactoring parse_ansible_inventory to use ansible_runner's
get_inventory we avoid that breakage, but we also lose out on the
pattern matching as that isn't supported. This function is called in two
places:

ceph_hosts_in_inventory: it didn't do any pattern matching at all, so it
isn't impacted by the change.

overcloud admin authorize: we can now offload the pattern matching to
Ansible itself via the limit_hosts parameter we pass to the playbook run
command, preserving the original functionality.

Closes-Bug: #2007659
Change-Id: I08330ced3b31d0ff48a881501cae8bd726e36432
(cherry picked from commit 4d8fe985e0992bc93c048507fd78075058146e07)

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Iad55d38ee1bac5b3b88e58e4f99d10cc9e35973c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/66/791366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update centos 8 dep pieline to run with compose repos

Thsireview updates the config file for the centos 8
stream dependency pipeline to use :
https://composes.centos.org/latest-CentOS-Stream-8/compose/

This will allow testing ahead of the updated rpms that
land in Centos 8 Stream mirrors.

Change-Id: Ifc13c3dd90d275bcafd78bfef233d40c0bbcf799

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-28 08:10:13.000000000', 'files': ['tools/yaml-validate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/63aaf85c17abe999b3363ab79d6e5879ca9ced2b', 'message': 'Improve volumes format check of yaml-validate.py

Currently, yaml-validate.py cannot detect trailing slashes under
"list_concat" and "if".

  volumes:
    - /example:/example/ # <======= detected

  volumes:
    list_concat:
    - - /example1:/example1/ # <===== not detected
      - /example2:/example2
    - if:
      - {get_param: TestValue}
      - - /example3:/example3/ # <==== not detected
        - /example4:/example4

This fix makes yaml-validate.py detect the these trailing slashes.

Because the current implementation digs "list" twice in one call to
check_volumes(), trailing slashes under "list_concat" are not detected.
Because the current implementation ignores "if", trailing slashes under
"if" are not deleted. check_volumes() doesn't have to ignore "if"
because non-volume-style value is ignored because of IndexError.

Change-Id: I4288738c2c95ab990024845fa43653854e790bd8
(cherry picked from commit d940f586147e40e52b53b44c239e113a6d460747)
(cherry picked from commit 346cda59b69dcaf1a4055f6ae6a795392f4662d4)

commit_message:
Improve volumes format check of yaml-validate.py

Currently, yaml-validate.py cannot detect trailing slashes under
"list_concat" and "if".

  volumes:
    - /example:/example/ # <======= detected

  volumes:
    list_concat:
    - - /example1:/example1/ # <===== not detected
      - /example2:/example2
    - if:
      - {get_param: TestValue}
      - - /example3:/example3/ # <==== not detected
        - /example4:/example4

This fix makes yaml-validate.py detect the these trailing slashes.

Because the current implementation digs "list" twice in one call to
check_volumes(), trailing slashes under "list_concat" are not detected.
Because the current implementation ignores "if", trailing slashes under
"if" are not deleted. check_volumes() doesn't have to ignore "if"
because non-volume-style value is ignored because of IndexError.

Change-Id: I4288738c2c95ab990024845fa43653854e790bd8
(cherry picked from commit d940f586147e40e52b53b44c239e113a6d460747)
(cherry picked from commit 346cda59b69dcaf1a4055f6ae6a795392f4662d4)

added_lines: elif isinstance(volumes, list): return sum([check_volumes(item) for item in volumes]) elif isinstance(volumes, dict): return sum([check_volumes(item) for item in volumes.values()]) elif isinstance(volumes, str): vol_def = volumes.split(':') try: if vol_def[0][-1] == '/' or vol_def[1][-1] == '/': print('ERROR: trailing "/" detected' ' for {}'.format(volumes)) return 1 except IndexError: # Not a volume definition, ignore it pass return 0
deleted_lines: result = 0 if isinstance(volumes, list): for vol in volumes: if isinstance(vol, dict): # Avoid 'if', 'get_*' etc continue elif isinstance(vol, list): for item in vol: result += check_volumes(item) elif isinstance(vol, str): vol_def = vol.split(':') try: if vol_def[0][-1] == '/' or vol_def[1][-1] == '/': print('ERROR: trailing "/" detected' ' for {}'.format(vol)) return 1 except IndexError: # Not a volume definition, ignore it continue elif isinstance(volumes, dict): # Step into 'list_concat', 'map_*' etc. for item in volumes.values(): result += check_volumes(item) return result

commit_message:
Increase octavia's lb_build_timeout setting for fs062

The default value for load_balancer.lb_build_timeout is 900s (15min) in
featureset062.
octavia-tempest-plugin has been hitting this timeout often since amphora
images are based on centos-stream. Let's increase this value to 1200s
(20min).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/801266

Change-Id: I7694b5ca68117cf97b4ad472a07ea276773cdd91

commit_message:
Glance: Avoid simultaneous clean/pruner job

This change introduces randomized delays to cache clean/pruner job
commands so that these commands are not executed simultaneously in
multiple nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1979271
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/846569
Change-Id: Icf8727779de746fe85e76206291be50b77bfe6eb
(cherry picked from commit 376a8a46c3ee898639cab4016ba150342cf83a1a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/849827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: glance::cache::cleaner::maxdelay: 1800 glance::cache::pruner::maxdelay: 1800

commit_message:
WIP: Exclude cloud-init-22.* from Appstream for c8

Remove cloud-init-22.*  for release files to avoid
deploy failures on c8 jobs.

Change-Id: I73deb8895f97665e0dd8457ffb5eeb18a88e800f
Related-Bug: #1971751

commit_message:
Add fips env file if fips enabled

This change should only be merged once the feaureset 052 is fully FIPS compatible,
as it makes FIPS new default behavior.

Change-Id: Id21f0d0e27c4aecdf6e246fe19d4669936970e62

commit_message:
WIP - Test replacing paramiko in ansible with libssh

This patch will attempt to replace paramiko with pylibssh in order
to, firstly, use a fips compliant library.  This will hopefully get
around the issues we're seeing with rsa keys in our fips tests.
See https://www.ansible.com/blog/new-libssh-connection-plugin-for-ansible-network
for details.

Change-Id: I94e47469ccb53cc581b4ddbbd8e5e5f60b20d1a5

commit_message:
Migrate Ansible roles to use FQCN

With Ansible moving to the collections [1]
structure, we will need to conform to the FQCN
format rather than naming modules like we
previously did eg:

We need to use:
`ansible.builtin.shell:`

instead of just:
`shell:`

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/style_guide/index.html#adding-links-to-modules-and-plugins

Change-Id: If7539e163eee1b6969ccdadac96c0b8e1af2d505

WIP Add new featureset067 for the sc010 ovn-provider

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/42/850342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #################################################################################################### # FEATURESET067 - TRIPLEO STANDALONE FOR OCTAVIA OVN-PROVIDER - TRACKS SCENARIO 10 # This is a modified version of featureset 062 (octavia) so changes made # to that featureset should be examined to see if they are relevant here. #################################################################################################### non_root_user_setup: true ovb_setup_connectivity: false package_installs: true vxlan_networking: false toci_vxlan_networking: false enable_vbmc: false deploy_supplemental_node: false undercloud_setup: true # role / scenario definition # deployment role standalone_role: Standalone.yaml # custom env files standalone_custom_env_files: - /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/low-memory-usage.yaml standalone_container_cli: podman # We need to selectively re-enable the globally blacklisted octavia tempest # plugin. tempest_private_net_seg_id: '' test_ping: false # os_tempest config use_os_tempest: true tempest_test_periodic: - '^octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_load_balancer.LoadBalancerScenarioTest' tempest_test_check: - '^octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario.v2.test_load_balancer.LoadBalancerScenarioTest' tempest_test_whitelist: >- {% if ('periodic' in zuul.pipeline and not job.force_non_periodic|default(false)|bool) or (job.force_periodic|default(false)|bool) -%} {{ tempest_test_periodic }} {%- else -%} {{ tempest_test_check }} {%- endif -%} tempest_services: - octavia - neutron tempest_run_concurrency: 2 download_amphora: false tempestconf_override: load_balancer.provider: 'ovn' load_balancer.test_reuse_connection: false load_balancer.load_balancing_algorithm: 'SOURCE_IP_PORT' load_balancer.test_flavors: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.health_monitor_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.pool_algorithms_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.l7_protocol_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.l4_protocol: 'TCP' loadbalancer-feature-enabled.session_persistence_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.not_implemented_is_error: false load_balancer.test_with_ipv6: false network-feature-enabled.port_security: true load_balancer.test_server_path: >- "/usr/lib/python{{ [ansible_python.version.major, ansible_python.version.minor] | join('.') }}/site-packages/octavia_tempest_plugin/contrib/test_server/test_server.bin" load_balancer.RBAC_test_type: "keystone_default_roles" tempestconf_train_override: load_balancer.provider: 'ovn' load_balancer.test_reuse_connection: false load_balancer.load_balancing_algorithm: 'SOURCE_IP_PORT' load_balancer.test_flavors: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.health_monitor_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.pool_algorithms_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.l7_protocol_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.l4_protocol: 'TCP' loadbalancer-feature-enabled.session_persistence_enabled: false loadbalancer-feature-enabled.not_implemented_is_error: false load_balancer.test_with_ipv6: false network-feature-enabled.port_security: true load_balancer.test_server_path: >- "/usr/lib/python{{ [ansible_python.version.major, ansible_python.version.minor] | join('.') }}/site-packages/octavia_tempest_plugin/contrib/test_server/test_server.bin" # Specific for train load_balancer.RBAC_test_type: "owner_or_admin" load_balancer.member_role: '"Member"' tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides: "{{ tempestconf_train_override if release in ['train'] else tempestconf_override }}" tempest_os_cloud: standalone

commit_message:
Configure new RBAC type for Octavia tempest

The policy override file was updated in the Octavia package [0], the old
"owner_or_admin" override file was switched to the
"keystone_default_roles" file.
Now the configuration for octavia-tempest-plugin must be updated
accordingly. This commit sets the [load_balancer]/RBAC_test_type
setting from tempest.conf to keystone_default_roles on master and stable
branches, but it keeps the old default value for train.

[0] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/octavia-distgit/+/43788

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/850033
Change-Id: I47f8b2ac9513313597b7d5536d0b340685ccf2b9

commit_message:
Documentation sections Getting started and Basic usage edited.

Changes were made in section Getting started so it will guide user to the Basic usage section more properly.
The patch edits this section so it is more corredponding with the fact that the Basic usage section is for the user optional.

Changes were made in the seciton Basic usage so the user recognises possible usage of the ansible variables in the deployment process.
The examples were added.

Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icf1894c59145f39bb8e70301351f47d05b0d2b6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/14/853414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This guide :ref:`basic_usage` will walk you through the basic setup and execution of TripleO-Quickstart. .. note:: The guide mentioned above is reffering to the basic setup and execution that the quickstart.sh can apply by default. For more specific invocations of TripleO-Quickstart please continue with the tasks below.Keep in mind that the deployment of the undercloud and also overcloud is controlled by ansible variables that can help you specify your needs. See :ref:`configuration` section for the usage example.
deleted_lines: For the most basic invocations of TripleO-Quickstart please refer to the :ref:`basic_usage`. This quide will walk you through the basic setup and execution. This document will walk through some more basic invocations of TripleO-Quickstart once you've had success with the steps outlined in the guide.

commit_message:
[DNM] Add temporary repo with ansible-collections-openstack 2.0.0 preview

This patch is adding a new temporary repo which contains a package for
a-o-c 2.0.0 preview and python3-openstacksdk-0.101.0 which is current
u-c version.

Also is updating the version installed with galaxy to the same commit as
the pre-release package.

Change-Id: I458677abf666259060396946cb88ba72f822e4b5

commit_message:
fix supported_distro_check

Without the bool filter, this variable doesn't evaluate properly.

Also changed the msg to use a literal block scalar, the other syntax
while valid was tripping up vim syntax highlighting.

Change-Id: I09afc64f50de4bbbe116d4b116a1fd70d3b91c02

commit_message:
install-deps.sh: default python_cmd to python3

It's 2022, python2 has been EOL for over 2 years. We should be
able to simplify this function by assuming python3, and setting
python2 for those few systems we still support.

This will add partial support for Rocky/Alma distributions without
explicitly stating so.

Change-Id: Id525f1f11b2cf0b6026da959e733c9e540b14ebc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/62/834362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PYTHON_CMD=python3 PYTHON_VIRTUALENV_CMD=venv rhel|centos) distribution_major_version=${VERSION_ID%.*} distribution_minor_version=${VERSION_ID#*.} if [ $distribution_major_version -eq "7" ]; then if [ $distribution_minor_version -ge "8" ] && [[ $python_val =~ "python3-" ]]; then else PYTHON_CMD=python2 PYTHON_VIRTUALENV_CMD=virtualenv python_cmd=${USER_PYTHON_OVERRIDE:-$PYTHON_CMD}
deleted_lines: distribution=unknown distribution_major_version=unknown # we prefer python2 because on few systems python->python3 distribution_major_version=${VERSION_ID%.*} distribution=${ID} PYTHON_CMD=python2 PYTHON_VIRTUALENV_CMD=virtualenv rhel) distribution="RedHat" if [ "$distribution_major_version" -ge "9" ]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 PYTHON_VIRTUALENV_CMD=venv elif [ "$distribution_major_version" -eq "8" ]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 fi ;; centos) distribution="CentOS" if [ "$distribution_major_version" -ge "9" ]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 PYTHON_VIRTUALENV_CMD=venv elif [ "$distribution_major_version" -eq "8" ]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 elif [ "$distribution_major_version" -eq "7" ]; then release_val=$(cat /etc/centos-release | awk '{print $4 }' | grep '^7.8\|^7.9') if [ ! -z $release_val ] && [[ $python_val =~ "python3-" ]]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 fedora) distribution="Fedora" if [ "$distribution_major_version" -ge "28" ]; then PYTHON_CMD=python3 fi ;; ubuntu) distribution="Ubuntu" ;; debian) distribution="Debian" ;; python_cmd=${USER_PYTHON_OVERRIDE:-$PYTHON_CMD} elif [ -f /etc/lsb-release ]; then . /etc/lsb-release distribution=${DISTRIB_ID}xx distribution_major_version=${DISTRIB_RELEASE%.*} elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ]; then distribution="Debian" distribution_major_version=$(cat /etc/debian_version | cut -d. -f1) else # Covers for FreeBSD and many others distribution=$(uname -s) if [ $distribution = Darwin ]; then distribution="MacOSX" distribution_major_version=$(sw_vers -productVersion | cut -d. -f1) fi which $python_cmd 2>&1 >/dev/null || { python_cmd=/usr/local/bin/python2.7 }

commit_message:
Condition ansible-collections-openstack version on release

In preparation for the coming breaking changes in
openstack-ansible-collections starting in Zed, this updates
quickstart.sh to install the version of the collections that's
compatible with the release being deployed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/844141

Change-Id: I014ef50269fc195f582d6d7e5cfe49294025ee30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/97/843497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OS_COLLECTIONS="ansible-config_template tripleo-operator-ansible" # Install ansible-collections-openstack separately to account for different releases ACO_BRANCH=master if [[ $OPT_RELEASE =~ .*(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby).* ]]; then ACO_BRANCH=stable/1.0.0 fi if [[ -d ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack ]]; then # Install zuul-cloned repo pushd ~/src/opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack git checkout $ACO_BRANCH ansible-galaxy collection install --force . \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections popd else ansible-galaxy collection install --force \ git+https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack,$ACO_BRANCH \ -p $VIRTUAL_ENV/share/ansible/collections fi

commit_message:
Update the copyright year.

Use the datetime module and get the current year. To have always an
right copyright year.

Change-Id: Ifdeb128d541bd8c062818bef96d1d6427ffaeca0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/93/686593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from datetime import datetimenow = datetime.now()copyright = u'{year}, OpenStack Foundation'.format(year=now.year)

list out pip modules in install_deps.sh

adding some more information for debugging
when there are issues with pip conflicts or
missing packages

commit_message:
Drop variables for TripleO UI

TripleO UI is already retired. The tasks to manage TripleO UI are now
always skipped because the software is no longer installed and these
are now being removed by [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/862210/

Change-Id: I766b388260c19607dfbeefc9ba519412ac262a4e

commit_message:
Exclude pcs-0.10.14-6.el8.x86_64 in t and w c8

This is to work around the linked bug which
affects c8 wallaby and train integration and
component lines.

The downgrade is to pcs-0.10.14-5.el8.x86_64

Related-Bug: #1997939
Change-Id: I18c6ecc1bb3c48617f16eb429ba108b243ec59e2
